item.title: Trusting God When You Don't Understand | Joseph Swan | Passion Point (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: Trusting God When You Don't Understand | Joseph Swan | Passion Point (Part 3)
item.description: Life has a way of throwing circumstances our way that we can't understand or make sense of. When this happens, how can you trust God?
item.content:encoded: Life has a way of throwing circumstances our way that we can't understand or make sense of. When this happens, how can you trust God?

item.title: How to Know God's Plan for My Life | Deniel Sewell | Passion Point (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: How to Know God's Plan for My Life | Deniel Sewell | Passion Point (Part 2)
item.description: Sometimes it feels like you don't know where your life is headed, or how to understand what is happening around you. How do you discover God's will for your life? And what do you do when it feels like reality isn't matching up with your hopes?
item.content:encoded: Sometimes it feels like you don't know where your life is headed, or how to understand what is happening around you. How do you discover God's will for your life? And what do you do when it feels like reality isn't matching up with your hopes?

item.title: Hope in the Storms of Life | Dan Brubacher | Passion Point (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: Hope in the Storms of Life | Dan Brubacher | Passion Point (Part 1)
item.description: Storms of life come whether we are ready or not. How can you persevere and find hope in the midst of them?
item.content:encoded: Storms of life come whether we are ready or not. How can you persevere and find hope in the midst of them?

item.title: Finding Community in a Polarized World | Jeff Brodie | Let's Be Human Again (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: Finding Community in a Polarized World | Jeff Brodie | Let's Be Human Again (Part 3)
item.description: Stories. They are the accounts of who we are. It's the summary of our stories that build our lives. Nothing is more personal than authentically listening to or sharing your story.
item.content:encoded: Stories. They are the accounts of who we are. It's the summary of our stories that build our lives. Nothing is more personal than authentically listening to or sharing your story.

item.title: Rebooting Relationships After The Pandemic | Jeff Brodie| Being Human Again (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: Rebooting Relationships After The Pandemic | Jeff Brodie| Being Human Again (Part 2)
item.description: If you were asked how Jesus lived his life on earth as a blessing, chances are you would say healings, the crucifixion, or preaching, but you probably wouldn't say eating. However, when you look at the life of Jesus he spent much of his time at parties connecting with people and serving them. What if the key to making an impact and rekindling relationships in our polarized society is as simple as having dinner together? What if at the heart of being human is humility itself?
item.content:encoded: If you were asked how Jesus lived his life on earth as a blessing, chances are you would say healings, the crucifixion, or preaching, but you probably wouldn't say eating. However, when you look at the life of Jesus he spent much of his time at parties connecting with people and serving them. What if the key to making an impact and rekindling relationships in our polarized society is as simple as having dinner together? What if at the heart of being human is humility itself?

item.title: Building Healthy Relationships in 2022 - Jeff Brodie - Let's Be Human Again (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: Building Healthy Relationships in 2022 - Jeff Brodie - Let's Be Human Again (Part 2)
item.description: Over the last two years, your friendship circles have shrunk and your social skills have likely atrophied alongside them. On top of that, you can feel an awkwardness about some of your friends. Things seem more polarized, even divided. But here's what's exciting. As we rekindle relationships on the backside of restrictions, the Holy Spirit wants us to invite him into our conversations. It's not another task to do, but a way of intentionally being yourself. In this series, we'll be looking at the secret to authentically living out your faith in a way where you see God change your friend's lives as you live yours. It's not a program or even a radical change, it's the possibility that opens up with an intentional shift that anyone can make, and we're excited to share it with you.
item.content:encoded: Over the last two years, your friendship circles have shrunk and your social skills have likely atrophied alongside them. On top of that, you can feel an awkwardness about some of your friends. Things seem more polarized, even divided. But here's what's exciting. As we rekindle relationships on the backside of restrictions, the Holy Spirit wants us to invite him into our conversations. It's not another task to do, but a way of intentionally being yourself. In this series, we'll be looking at the secret to authentically living out your faith in a way where you see God change your friend's lives as you live yours. It's not a program or even a radical change, it's the possibility that opens up with an intentional shift that anyone can make, and we're excited to share it with you.

item.title: The Power of an Invitation | Tammy Giffen
item.itunes:title: The Power of an Invitation | Tammy Giffen
item.description: For God so loved the world. What does that mean? Did Jesus really come FOR you? To pursue you? How did he do that and what does it mean? What invitation is extended to us?
item.content:encoded: For God so loved the world. What does that mean? Did Jesus really come FOR you? To pursue you? How did he do that and what does it mean? What invitation is extended to us?

item.title: What is Obedience to God - Mark Clark - The Book of Jonah (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: What is Obedience to God - Mark Clark - The Book of Jonah (Part 3)
item.description:
So, God gives you a word or a message but then what? Jonah didn't want to hear the message God gave him at first, so God again spoke to Jonah with the same message for a second time. God gave Jonah a second chance to live out the purpose He had called him to. What about you? Have you ever felt like you've needed a second chance with God?

In the final part of this series, Mark challenges us to remove the distractions and refocus on the mission God has called us to; to share the hope of Jesus.
item.content:encoded:

In the final part of this series, Mark challenges us to remove the distractions and refocus on the mission God has called us to; to share the hope of Jesus.

item.title: You Can Start Over - The Book Of Jonah - Mark Clark
item.itunes:title: You Can Start Over - The Book Of Jonah - Mark Clark
item.description: Ever think that God is done with you? That it's too late to start over? You're not the first person to think that. In this message, Mark Clark walks us through a Turning point for Jonah in the Book of Jonah.
item.content:encoded: Ever think that God is done with you? That it's too late to start over? You're not the first person to think that. In this message, Mark Clark walks us through a Turning point for Jonah in the Book of Jonah.

item.title: God Can (And Will) Use You - Mark Clark - Jonah (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: God Can (And Will) Use You - Mark Clark - Jonah (Part 1)
item.description:
Jonah was going about his life, just going through the motions. He lived with fears, doubts, insecurities and even ran from God when He called out to him. What about you? If you inserted your name where Jonah's is - how similar would that description be of your life currently?

The good news is that God wants to use you in spite of who you are or what you've done, not because of you.
item.content:encoded:
Jonah was going about his life, just going through the motions. He lived with fears, doubts, insecurities and even ran from God when He called out to him. What about you? If you inserted your name where Jonah's is - how similar would that description be of your life currently?

The good news is that God wants to use you in spite of who you are or what you've done, not because of you.

item.title: Managing Unmet Expecations - Jeff Brodie - Reset (Part 4
item.itunes:title: Managing Unmet Expecations - Jeff Brodie - Reset (Part 4
item.description: To realize your calling seven days a week involves something the¬† culture doesn't understand. Rather than making your life about getting, the Gospel will challenge you to make it about giving.¬†
item.content:encoded: To realize your calling seven days a week involves something the culture doesn't understand. Rather than making your life about getting, the Gospel will challenge you to make it about giving.

item.title: You Should Stop Going To Church | Carey Nieuhwof | Reset (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: You Should Stop Going To Church | Carey Nieuhwof | Reset (Part 3)
item.description:
Our culture is more divided than ever‚Äîvaxxed versus unvaxxed, masks versus no masks, conservatives versus progressives, church attenders who gather versus attenders who don't.¬† Even Christians are at a loss to know how to respond. Enter the radical idea of the church.¬†

Going to church produces a group of people who reflect culture. Being the church produces a group of people who change culture.¬†
item.content:encoded:
Our culture is more divided than ever‚Äîvaxxed versus unvaxxed, masks versus no masks, conservatives versus progressives, church attenders who gather versus attenders who don't. Even Christians are at a loss to know how to respond. Enter the radical idea of the church.

Going to church produces a group of people who reflect culture. Being the church produces a group of people who change culture.

item.title: You Know Too Much...And Too Little | Carey Nieuwhof | Reset (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: You Know Too Much...And Too Little | Carey Nieuwhof | Reset (Part 2)
item.description:
One of the challenges of being alive today is that information comes at you from every direction 24/7. You know too much.¬†

And yet you also don't know enough. Because the most helpful information is being forgotten or lost. All of this takes us back to the Garden of Eden. This week, you'll discover why having the knowledge of God without the wisdom of God can kill. And you'll also see how knowing the wisdom of God can change everything for you.¬†
item.content:encoded:
One of the challenges of being alive today is that information comes at you from every direction 24/7. You know too much.

And yet you also don't know enough. Because the most helpful information is being forgotten or lost. All of this takes us back to the Garden of Eden. This week, you'll discover why having the knowledge of God without the wisdom of God can kill. And you'll also see how knowing the wisdom of God can change everything for you.

item.title: How to Deal With The Uncertainty In Life | Jeff Brodie | Reset (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: How to Deal With The Uncertainty In Life | Jeff Brodie | Reset (Part 1)
item.description: If you've ever started watching a movie halfway through, not only is it almost impossible to figure out what's happening, but it can look like there's no hope for the end. But then you get to the end of the movie, and things resolve...often beautifully. Life is like that because the gospel is like that. God wins in the end. And as hard as that seems to believe, that means he's winning now.¬†
item.content:encoded: If you've ever started watching a movie halfway through, not only is it almost impossible to figure out what's happening, but it can look like there's no hope for the end. But then you get to the end of the movie, and things resolve...often beautifully. Life is like that because the gospel is like that. God wins in the end. And as hard as that seems to believe, that means he's winning now.

item.title: Let Go of Your Struggles | Joseph Swan | Unburdened
item.itunes:title: Let Go of Your Struggles | Joseph Swan | Unburdened
item.description: God's plan for our lives is that we would "run and not grow weary, walk and not faint." Sometimes we struggle to step into all that he has planned for us due to the weight we carry from our past. There is a better way. Because of what Jesus did at the cross, God has made a way for us to live our lives unburdened.

Sometimes we struggle to step into all that he has planned for us due to the weight we carry from our past. There is a better way. item.title: Be The Good | Andy Stanley | Christmas: It's All Good (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: Be The Good | Andy Stanley | Christmas: It's All Good (Part 3)
item.description: Every generation of Jesus followers is responsible to ensure the news of the Christian faith stays true to the original. So are you good news? What if you're the only news someone gets?

item.title: What Did Jesus Come For? | Andy Stanley | Christmas: It's All Good (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: What Did Jesus Come For? | Andy Stanley | Christmas: It's All Good (Part 2)
item.description: The original message of Jesus was so compelling that everyone who heard it wanted it to be true. Maybe the version you've heard isn't as captivating. If Jesus truly offered an invitation that left no one out, would you consider it really good news?
item.content:encoded: The original message of Jesus was so compelling that everyone who heard it wanted it to be true. Maybe the version you've heard isn't as captivating. If Jesus truly offered an invitation that left no one out, would you consider it really good news?

item.itunes:title: Is Christianity Good? | Andy Stanley | Christmas: It's All Good (Part 1)
item.description: People close to Jesus were convinced they had met good personified. So they documented the story. They were convinced it wasn't just for a nation or for a generation, but for all nations and every generation. This was good news, great joy, for all people‚Äîperhaps especially for those of us who aren't all that good.

But many of us don't live that way. So where do you start?¬†

item.title: The Holy Spirit - In The Bible | Jeff Brodie | The Beginners Guide to the Holy Spirit (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: The Holy Spirit - In The Bible | Jeff Brodie | The Beginners Guide to the Holy Spirit (Part 1)
item.description:
"In the name of the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit".¬†

You've probably heard this phrase to describe God as some part of a ceremony or service. You know what a father and a son are, but what is a 'Holy Spirit'? How do you even relate to God as a 'Spirit? Is it a transcendent encounter, an emotion you feel, or a weird ghost or aura?¬†

Like many people, you might find the Holy Spirit to be a bit of a mystery, however, scripture teaches that the Spirit can be the source of power in your life; an opportunity to experience God and even live supernaturally. But many of us don't live that way. So where do you start?¬†
item.content:encoded:
"In the name of the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit".

You've probably heard this phrase to describe God as some part of a ceremony or service. You know what a father and a son are, but what is a 'Holy Spirit'? How do you even relate to God as a 'Spirit? Is it a transcendent encounter, an emotion you feel, or a weird ghost or aura?

Like many people, you might find the Holy Spirit to be a bit of a mystery, however, scripture teaches that the Spirit can be the source of power in your life; an opportunity to experience God and even live supernaturally. But many of us don't live that way. So where do you start?

item.title: What Does It Mean To Be Slothful? | Mark Clark | Trapped (Part 4)
item.itunes:title: What Does It Mean To Be Slothful? | Mark Clark | Trapped (Part 4)
item.description: The deadly sin of sloth will affect your life physically, intellectually, and spiritually. It can find expression in laziness and idleness. Be intentional with your time and energy on the mission of loving and serving God and others to enjoy Jesus now, in daily sacrifice.
item.content:encoded: The deadly sin of sloth will affect your life physically, intellectually, and spiritually. It can find expression in laziness and idleness. Be intentional with your time and energy on the mission of loving and serving God and others to enjoy Jesus now, in daily sacrifice.

item.title: Find Freedom From Pornography | Mark Clark | Trapped (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: Find Freedom From Pornography | Mark Clark | Trapped (Part 3)
item.description: Lust is a strong passion of longing, especially for sexual desire, when we objectify another person for our own personal pleasure. It is not a private sin but also destroys the lives of others. Fight this sin actively and help one another pursue the ultimate pleasure/fulfillment found only in Jesus.
item.content:encoded: Lust is a strong passion of longing, especially for sexual desire, when we objectify another person for our own personal pleasure. It is not a private sin but also destroys the lives of others. Fight this sin actively and help one another pursue the ultimate pleasure/fulfillment found only in Jesus.

item.title: Is Anger a Sin? | Mark Clark | Trapped (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: Is Anger a Sin? | Mark Clark | Trapped (Part 1)
item.description: Anger is a desire for vengeance, an emotion of resentment toward others or circumstances that arise out of self-preservation and one's life or ego being challenged or threatened. Anger is not inherently evil. Recognize when it is sinful, placing one's life or ego above all else, and learn how to fight it. Be challenged to take on a righteous, holy anger that helps correct injustices and expresses God's righteousness.

item.title: Conquering Worry | Jeff Brodie | Head Space (Part 4)
item.itunes:title: Conquering Worry | Jeff Brodie | Head Space (Part 4)
item.description: The conversations you have most often are the ones you have in your own mind. And if you are honest, they are likely more negative than positive. ¬†Here's what's critical: How you think tends to become how you live your life. What if it were possible to move towards internal freedom and win the war in your mind?

item.title: How to Pursue Happiness In Your Life | Ben Hilson | Pursuing Happiness
item.itunes:title: How to Pursue Happiness In Your Life | Ben Hilson | Pursuing Happiness
item.description: What makes you happy? Don't think too hard about your answer ... what comes to mind first? Good food, cheering for your favourite team, an afternoon of shopping, or sitting on the beach. But what about God? Have you ever thought about his happiness? In this message, Ben unpacks how God's happiness is tied to ours and what that means for our lives.
item.content:encoded: What makes you happy? Don't think too hard about your answer ... what comes to mind first? Good food, cheering for your favourite team, an afternoon of shopping, or sitting on the beach. But what about God? Have you ever thought about his happiness? In this message, Ben unpacks how God's happiness is tied to ours and what that means for our lives.

item.title: Avoiding Distractions | Jeff Brodie | Rebuilding You (Part 4)
item.itunes:title: Avoiding Distractions | Jeff Brodie | Rebuilding You (Part 4)
item.description: So you're on the journey of rebuilding something that matters--your relationship with your daughter, your marriage, your personal finances. But as you're making progress, the distractions start to creep in. A few extra hours at the office, some extra time on Netflix, the opinions of your friends when you say no to their invitation. So what do you do? How do you stop getting distracted from rebuilding what matters most?
item.content:encoded: So you're on the journey of rebuilding something that matters--your relationship with your daughter, your marriage, your personal finances. But as you're making progress, the distractions start to creep in. A few extra hours at the office, some extra time on Netflix, the opinions of your friends when you say no to their invitation. So what do you do? How do you stop getting distracted from rebuilding what matters most?

item.title: Rebuilding in the Face of Opposition | Jeff Brodie | Rebuilding You (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: Rebuilding in the Face of Opposition | Jeff Brodie | Rebuilding You (Part 3)
item.description:
Whatever road you take in life, you're going to meet resistance and obstacles. How do you handle that? Do you push through it? Avoid it? Meet it? When you are trying to rebuild but things are standing in your way, is there a path through?

In this message, we'll discover how to rebuild the broken parts of your life, even when you meet resistance head on.
item.content:encoded: Whatever road you take in life, you're going to meet resistance and obstacles. How do you handle that? Do you push through it? Avoid it? Meet it? When you are trying to rebuild but things are standing in your way, is there a path through? In this message, we'll discover how to rebuild the broken parts of your life, even when you meet resistance head on.

item.title: Steps to Rebuilding Your Life | Jeff Brodie | Rebuilding You (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: Steps to Rebuilding Your Life | Jeff Brodie | Rebuilding You (Part 2)
item.description: When you look at the brokenness in your life, it can be hard to see a way out. And what are the practical steps to fix what's broken? How do you rebuild the broken parts of your life? What can you do, today, to heal what's hurting? In this message, we'll share 3 practical steps you can take towards 'Rebuilding You'.
item.content:encoded: When you look at the brokenness in your life, it can be hard to see a way out. And what are the practical steps to fix what's broken? How do you rebuild the broken parts of your life? What can you do, today, to heal what's hurting? In this message, we'll share 3 practical steps you can take towards 'Rebuilding You'.

item.title: When You Feel Broken Inside | Jeff Brodie | Rebuilding You (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: When You Feel Broken Inside | Jeff Brodie | Rebuilding You (Part 1)
item.description:
What do you do when you feel broken inside? If you're honest, after the year we've had, you don't have to look very far to see brokenness in the world around you--or in your own life.

You see people you love facing mental health challenges, marriage struggles, sickness, and even financial hardship. On the other hand, you and I are rebuilders! God calls us to be a force for change in the world.

We love a good restoration, makeover, or story of redemption. But where do we start? How do you rebuild your broken world?
item.content:encoded:
What do you do when you feel broken inside? If you're honest, after the year we've had, you don't have to look very far to see brokenness in the world around you--or in your own life.

You see people you love facing mental health challenges, marriage struggles, sickness, and even financial hardship. On the other hand, you and I are rebuilders! God calls us to be a force for change in the world.

We love a good restoration, makeover, or story of redemption. But where do we start? How do you rebuild your broken world?

item.title: Steps To Greatness | Vijay Krishnan | True Greatness
item.itunes:title: Steps To Greatness | Vijay Krishnan | True Greatness
item.description: Our world, in many ways, is about pursuing what's next, what's better, what's greater. Greatness has really taken on a whole new level in our lives, and people of every age and stage are looking for the next best way to achieve greatness. A better job, a bigger house, a more successful business, a happier family, a higher education--it's all a constant pursuit that on the other side can sometimes leave us with regrets. We have all been made, even created, with something in us that desires greatness. But how do we have true greatness without regrets?
item.content:encoded: Our world, in many ways, is about pursuing what's next, what's better, what's greater. Greatness has really taken on a whole new level in our lives, and people of every age and stage are looking for the next best way to achieve greatness. We have all been made, even created, with something in us that desires greatness. But how do we have true greatness without regrets?

item.title: Help Me See | Andy Stanley | Grown Up Prayers (Part 4)
item.itunes:title: Help Me See | Andy Stanley | Grown Up Prayers (Part 4)
item.description: We want to be more open-minded, but we naturally resist things we can't control or don't understand. So how can we learn to be open to changing our ideals and beliefs, especially if we may be wrong about something? It begins with a simple prayer.
item.content:encoded: We want to be more open-minded, but we naturally resist things we can't control or don't understand. So how can we learn to be open to changing our ideals and beliefs, especially if we may be wrong about something? It begins with a simple prayer.

item.title: How To Avoid Temptation | Andy Stanley | Grown Up Prayers (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: How To Avoid Temptation | Andy Stanley | Grown Up Prayers (Part 3)
item.description: Jesus told his followers to pray to avoid temptation. But before we can pray that with a clear conscience, there are some things we need to ask ourselves first.
item.content:encoded: Jesus told his followers to pray to avoid temptation. But before we can pray that with a clear conscience, there are some things we need to ask ourselves first.

item.title: Pray Like This | Andy Stanley | Grown Up Prayers (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: Pray Like This | Andy Stanley | Grown Up Prayers (Part 2)
item.description: If God already knows my needs, why pray? Because the purpose of prayer is to surrender your will, not impose it.
item.content:encoded: If God already knows my needs, why pray? Because the purpose of prayer is to surrender your will, not impose it.

item.title: Teach Us To Pray | Andy Stanley | Grown Up Prayers (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: Teach Us To Pray | Andy Stanley | Grown Up Prayers (Part 1)
item.description: At one time or another, we've all been told we should pray. But how should we pray? Jesus's disciples had the exact same question.
item.content:encoded: At one time or another, we've all been told we should pray. But how should we pray? Jesus's disciples had the exact same question.

item.title: How Generosity Changes The Way You See The World | Jeff Brodie | Chasing Contentment (Part 4)
item.itunes:title: How Generosity Changes The Way You See The World | Jeff Brodie | Chasing Contentment (Part 4)
item.description:
When you look at scripture and the world around you, do you see God as a God of abundance or a God of scarcity? How you see the world impacts your generosity.

Jesus teaches on money throughout the four Gospels because he knows it is a major competitor for your heart. Money is what we use to obtain what we possess in our lives. What if generosity with your funds is vital to your contentment? What if the ancient practice of tithing could be a key to happiness in your life?
item.content:encoded:
When you look at scripture and the world around you, do you see God as a God of abundance or a God of scarcity? How you see the world impacts your generosity.

Jesus teaches on money throughout the four Gospels because he knows it is a major competitor for your heart. Money is what we use to obtain what we possess in our lives. What if generosity with your funds is vital to your contentment? What if the ancient practice of tithing could be a key to happiness in your life?

item.title: The Enemy Of Contentment | Jeff Brodie | Chasing Contentment (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: The Enemy Of Contentment | Jeff Brodie | Chasing Contentment (Part 3)
item.description:
Our stuff and the money we buy it with are a part of our everyday lives. We talk about them often. However, when Jesus begins to challenge us on how we manage our resources, we can feel emotionally reluctant. Why is that?

On one hand, we live in one of the wealthiest parts of the world, and yet there's something about our consumer-driven culture that leaves us unsatisfied. What drives that dissatisfaction? And what if we did listen to what Jesus has to say about it?
item.content:encoded:
Our stuff and the money we buy it with are a part of our everyday lives. We talk about them often. However, when Jesus begins to challenge us on how we manage our resources, we can feel emotionally reluctant. Why is that?

item.title: What Did Jesus Say About Managing Your Resources? | Jeff Brodie | Chasing Contentment (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: What Did Jesus Say About Managing Your Resources? | Jeff Brodie | Chasing Contentment (Part 2)
item.description:
What does the bible say about managing resources? How do you actually live a kingdom-first life? Like practically ... what does that really mean? ‚Å† ‚Å†

You work hard for your money and contentment ... which grants you the ability to pay for the things you need, buy the stuff you want, and afford the experiences you enjoy.‚Å† ‚õ≥üöòüé£‚Å† ‚Å†

But does living a kingdom-first life mean you have to give all that up?‚Å†

item.title: Too Much Time, Too Little Contentment | Jeff Brodie | Chasing Contentment (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: Too Much Time, Too Little Contentment | Jeff Brodie | Chasing Contentment (Part 1)
item.description: Too much stuff? Let's face it. The ease of hitting "add to cart" is a little too easy. Then that package shows up on your front porch and it's exciting. If we're all honest, being home has brought out the shopping bug in all of us to fill the void of missing out. You know deep down that it only gives you a little happiness and then you're looking for the next thing to lift your spirits. What if true contentment came through something else, even something spiritual?
item.content:encoded: Too much stuff? Let's face it. The ease of hitting "add to cart" is a little too easy. Then that package shows up on your front porch and it's exciting. You know deep down that it only gives you a little happiness and then you're looking for the next thing to lift your spirits. What if true contentment came through something else, even something spiritual?

item.title: FORward | Jeff Brodie | What's Next For 2021?
item.itunes:title: FORward | Jeff Brodie | What's Next For 2021?
item.description: Over the last 15 months, our church has continued to be FOR people, and we've positioned ourselves to reach more people into the future. Lowering case counts and an increase in vaccinated individuals make us optimistic about opportunities to gather safely in the near future. So what does that mean for Connexus Church for the rest of 2021 as we reach people with the hope of Jesus? And how can you be a part of it?

item.title: All Work, No Play | Ben Hilson | The Daily Grind (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: All Work, No Play | Ben Hilson | The Daily Grind (Part 3)
item.description: They say that all work and no play makes jack a dull boy - could that be more true than you might think? What if play, and rest, was a crucial key to firing on all cylinders in every area of your life?
item.content:encoded: They say that all work and no play makes jack a dull boy - could that be more true than you might think? What if play, and rest, was a crucial key to firing on all cylinders in every area of your life?

item.title: Monday Motivation | Ben Hilson | The Daily Grind (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: Monday Motivation | Ben Hilson | The Daily Grind (Part 2)
item.description:
The pandemic has changed how we experience our work and see our purpose. One recent study shows that one in four employees is seriously considering a job change. While more people are working from home, others are on the front lines. Then there's the work of home life. You will likely work 90,000 hours in your lifetime, so work is worth thinking about. Work impacts your happiness, your health, and even shapes who you become.

What if your understanding of work is distorted? What if it's not about changing your job, but changing the way you see your life? What if work could be different?

item.title: Did Jesus Claim To Be God? | Mark Clark | The Problem Of Jesus (Part 4)
item.itunes:title: Did Jesus Claim To Be God? | Mark Clark | The Problem Of Jesus (Part 4)
item.description: Is Jesus God? What makes Christianity different from any other religion is that God actually entered our world and became human. "The Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we have seen his glory, glory as of the only Son [Jesus Christ] from the Father" (John 1:14). If this is true, isn't it worth breaking from the busyness of your life to listen to what he has to say, to learn from what he did? Don't you want to lean into the One who understands what it's like to be human?
item.content:encoded: Is Jesus God? What makes Christianity different from any other religion is that God actually entered our world and became human. "The Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we have seen his glory, glory as of the only Son [Jesus Christ] from the Father" (John 1:14). If this is true, isn't it worth breaking from the busyness of your life to listen to what he has to say, to learn from what he did? Don't you want to lean into the One who understands what it's like to be human?

item.title: Are Miracles Possible? | Mark Clark | The Problem Of Jesus (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: Are Miracles Possible? | Mark Clark | The Problem Of Jesus (Part 3)
item.description: What do we do with the millions of stories held by rational, credible people that defy all logic? Belief in miracles is seen by skeptics as something for the ancient mind - the naive and uninformed - and not for modern, scientific, rational people. But what if miracles are actually probable given the universe in which we live? What if the miracles we read about in the accounts of Jesus' life on earth really did happen? What would those miracles mean to us in our world today? Jesus' miracles weren't an end unto themselves. They relayed messages about God, love, humankind, and life.
item.content:encoded: What do we do with the millions of stories held by rational, credible people that defy all logic? Belief in miracles is seen by skeptics as something for the ancient mind - the naive and uninformed - and not for modern, scientific, rational people. What would those miracles mean to us in our world today? Jesus' miracles weren't an end unto themselves. They relayed messages about God, love, humankind, and life.

item.title: What Is The Importance Of Loving God? | Mark Clark | Problem Of Jesus (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: What Is The Importance Of Loving God? | Mark Clark | Problem Of Jesus (Part 2)
item.description: Jesus was asked to sum up all of the commandments in the Bible with the single greatest command. His response was: Love God with your whole self. So why does it seem so scandalous to live out the command to love God? Contrary to what you might think, the topic of loving God is one of the most neglected ideas in modern Christianity.
item.content:encoded: Jesus was asked to sum up all of the commandments in the Bible with the single greatest command. His response was: Love God with your whole self. So why does it seem so scandalous to live out the command to love God? Contrary to what you might think, the topic of loving God is one of the most neglected ideas in modern Christianity.

item.title: Are The Gospels Reliable? | Mark Clark | The Problem Of Jesus (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: Are The Gospels Reliable? | Mark Clark | The Problem Of Jesus (Part 1)
item.description: Jesus has never been more popular. Some love him, applauding him as a good teacher, a political revolutionary, or a prophetic voice speaking out against the rich and powerful. Others find him bigoted, old-fashioned, and narrow minded, even as they are forced to admit that his words and teachings are utterly unique. His presence infuses our political discussions and our dinner table debates, making him impossible to ignore.

item.title: How to Respond to Easter | Jeff Brodie | Easter 2021
item.itunes:title: How to Respond to Easter | Jeff Brodie | Easter 2021
item.description: The resurrection of Jesus after the cross stirred up different responses for those at the tomb - wonder, doubt, sadness, even jubilation. What will your response be this Easter 2021? Jesus' existence isn't something you can simply ignore.
item.content:encoded: The resurrection of Jesus after the cross stirred up different responses for those at the tomb - wonder, doubt, sadness, even jubilation. What will your response be this Easter 2021? Jesus' existence isn't something you can simply ignore.

item.title: How Jesus Responds to Failure and Brokenness | Jeff Brodie | CANCELLED (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: How Jesus Responds to Failure and Brokenness | Jeff Brodie | CANCELLED (Part 3)
item.description: In our culture, our access to power, influence, and judgment is faster than our access to knowledge and relationship. It's easy for us to jump on the bandwagon and cancel someone without truly knowing all the facts. As we look to influence people with the platform of our lives, how do we navigate our polarized world? What does it look like to engage a culture that cancels individuals so quickly? How did Jesus respond to someone being cancelled right in front of him?

item.title: Jesus and Cancel Culture ‚ùå Jeff Brodie ‚ùå CANCELLED (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: Jesus and Cancel Culture ‚ùå Jeff Brodie ‚ùå CANCELLED (Part 1)
item.description:
It seems like our culture is growing increasingly frustrated, contentious, and hostile. Social media is always ready to pounce on its next victim. If you are honest, under the pressure of our world, you've privately torn down, gossiped about, ghosted, or blamed someone this year. Culture can tell you it's okay to hurt someone--even cancel them-- in the name of truth.

Jesus has a radically different view of how you can approach your life. A way of living so freely that it's worth cancelling your membership in today's polarized culture.

item.title: How To Improve Your Relationship | Toni & Carey Nieuwhof | I Didn't SÃ∂iÃ∂gÃ∂nÃ∂ Up For This (Part 4)
item.itunes:title: How To Improve Your Relationship | Toni & Carey Nieuwhof | I Didn't SÃ∂iÃ∂gÃ∂nÃ∂ Up For This (Part 4)
item.description: It's common for couples who aren't getting along to start treating one another as opponents. But as Jesus reminds us, a house divided against itself cannot stand. Instead, we can choose to fight for 'we' instead of 'me.' When we agree to share power and operate as a team, we will be able to live out our marriage from a spirit of unity. Toni talked about three ways people can move past their conflict and bring more peace into their marriage.

item.title: Something Feels Off In My Relationship | Carey Nieuwhof | I Didn't SÃ∂iÃ∂gÃ∂nÃ∂ Up For This (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: Something Feels Off In My Relationship | Carey Nieuwhof | I Didn't SÃ∂iÃ∂gÃ∂nÃ∂ Up For This (Part 2)
item.description: Many relationships experience a slow slide into prolonged conflict. The person you once loved becomes the person you now loathe. When you're in that situation, many people begin to imagine they'd better off with someone else...or anybody else. Surely they'd treat you better. Care about you. Respect you. Be kind to you. True? Not so fast‚Ä¶ There is a way to turn the person you now loathe into the person you once again love.

item.title: My Partner Blames Me For Everything | Toni Nieuwhof | I Didn't SÃ∂iÃ∂gÃ∂nÃ∂ Up For This (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: My Partner Blames Me For Everything | Toni Nieuwhof | I Didn't SÃ∂iÃ∂gÃ∂nÃ∂ Up For This (Part 1)
item.description:
Have you ever fought in your relationships? üò† Maybe you're in the spot right now in your relationship where you can't help but think "this is not what I signed up for when I said yes." Or if things are great right now, you're probably thinking, "it can't get that bad, can it?" ü•∞

Toni Nieuwhof and Carey Nieuwhof share some practical skills and dig into what the Bible has to say as they unpack how to find what you really want for the future of your relationship.

item.title: How To Have Meaningful Conversations With Someone You Disagree With | The Hangover (Part 5)
item.itunes:title: How To Have Meaningful Conversations With Someone You Disagree With | The Hangover (Part 5)
item.description:
I respectfully disagree. How do you talk to someone you disagree with? Tough question, right? Meaningful conversation has become something that's so hard to grasp in our current culture of social change, where there are so many differing opinions, varied perspectives, and opposing views.

So when it comes down to it, how can you have meaningful conversations with the people you care about - even when you might dare to disagree with them? The Bible actually has a lot to say on this topic and this weekend we're jumping right in as The Hangover series continues with Jeff Brodie.

item.title: How Do You Find Meaning In Suffering and Success? | Jeff Brodie | The Hangover (Part 4)
item.itunes:title: How Do You Find Meaning In Suffering and Success? | Jeff Brodie | The Hangover (Part 4)
item.description:
2020 was a year of extremes. You experienced more ups and downs, adversity and prosperity, suffering and success than usual. We've all experienced it differently, but we've seen a common theme: there's something about the ups and downs of life that reveals our hearts and what's important to us.

Even after the pandemic is over, suffering and success will be a part of life. As we look ahead, how do we find meaning in those moments? They might have more in common than you think.
item.content:encoded:
2020 was a year of extremes. You experienced more ups and downs, adversity and prosperity, suffering and success than usual. We've all experienced it differently, but we've seen a common theme: there's something about the ups and downs of life that reveals our hearts and what's important to us.

Even after the pandemic is over, suffering and success will be a part of life. As we look ahead, how do we find meaning in those moments? They might have more in common than you think.

item.title: Less distraction. More meaning. | Jeff Brodie | The Hangover (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: Less distraction. More meaning. | Jeff Brodie | The Hangover (Part 3)
item.description:
Are you looking for less distraction in your life? Seriously. Anyone else get stuck in the mindless scroll? üôã‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èOr maybe a couple of extra episodes on Netflix? Or just a few more emails from work?

We get it. These days are LONG. You're stuck at home. Your kids are asking for the 38th snack of the day. You barely get one meal cleaned up before the next happens. Work is difficult ... it feels like everyone wants everything, now.

So a few minutes to yourself is a good thing, right?

But what if there was something more? A way you could turn the time you have on its head. Instead of making it to the next episode, you were looking forward to the next meaningful moment.

This Sunday, we're unpacking what it would look like to add more meaning to the way you use your time management. Not just for today, but for the long term.

Join us ... and invite your friends to tune in too!

Services streamed live at 8, 9, 10, & 11 am on YouTube.

Like, comment & subscribe to stay updated with the latest!

item.title: How To Find More Meaning In Your Life | Jeff Brodie | The Hangover (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: How To Find More Meaning In Your Life | Jeff Brodie | The Hangover (Part 1)
item.description: What brings meaning to your life? Be honest...your 2020 was a bit of a bust. Do you even remember your pre-pandemic life? Who knew the isolation, fear, or frustration you would face? At the same time, you did learn some things about yourself. So where does that leave you? What if your new year was pivotal for all the right reasons? This year, discover deeper meaning in your life. In this series, we're going to look at lessons from 2020 through scripture and apply them in a way that brings genuine meaning to your relationships, your time, and your struggles.
item.content:encoded: What brings meaning to your life? Be honest...your 2020 was a bit of a bust. Do you even remember your pre-pandemic life? Who knew the isolation, fear, or frustration you would face? At the same time, you did learn some things about yourself. So where does that leave you? What if your new year was pivotal for all the right reasons? This year, discover deeper meaning in your life. In this series, we're going to look at lessons from 2020 through scripture and apply them in a way that brings genuine meaning to your relationships, your time, and your struggles.

item.title: Moving from Surviving to Dreaming Again | Jeff Brodie | A Special New Year's Message
item.itunes:title: Moving from Surviving to Dreaming Again | Jeff Brodie | A Special New Year's Message
item.description: In many ways, we are living in a time of accelerated change. 2020 was a year where we experienced things we've never experienced before, and life will never be the same. But how do you move from seeing change as a threat to seeing it as an opportunity? How do you move from surviving to dreaming again?
item.content:encoded: In many ways, we are living in a time of accelerated change. 2020 was a year where we experienced things we've never experienced before, and life will never be the same. But how do you move from seeing change as a threat to seeing it as an opportunity? How do you move from surviving to dreaming again?

item.title: Decide The Win | Andy Stanley | Winning
item.itunes:title: Decide The Win | Andy Stanley | Winning
item.description: We all want to win. After all, winning is better than not winning. In a game a win is defined, but life is not a game. And winning in the most important areas of our lives isn't always clear. So, how do we win?
item.content:encoded: We all want to win. After all, winning is better than not winning. In a game a win is defined, but life is not a game. And winning in the most important areas of our lives isn't always clear. So, how do we win?

item.title: Hope Has A Name | Jeff Brodie| Christmas Eve Together
item.itunes:title: Hope Has A Name | Jeff Brodie| Christmas Eve Together
item.description: Christmas 2020 has been a year that no one expected, and you may be asking, can God still move in times like these? We believe God is going to do something amazing this Christmas as you look for hope in the unexpected, and start some new Christmas traditions.

item.itunes:title: How to Find Hope When Your Situation Feels Hopeless | Joseph Swan | Waiting For Hope (Part 3)
item.description: Are you in need of hope in a time of hopelessness? What happens in your waiting, when you've been waiting for what feels like forever? Does worry or depression creep in? Does anxiousness overwhelm? Maybe even darkness appears in your life. In those moments of worry, anxiousness, or darkness, what can you do? Who can you turn to?

item.itunes:title: Positioning Yourself to Share the Hope | Jeff Brodie | Waiting For Hope (Part 1)
item.description: You've held out for hope this year. The hope of lifted restrictions, perhaps the hope of a vaccine, the hope of a healthy diagnosis, or just hope for some good news in your life. item.title: Lessons On Life And Leadership with Toni and Carey Nieuwhof | Connexus Church
item.itunes:title: Lessons On Life And Leadership with Toni and Carey Nieuwhof | Connexus Church
item.description: Our founders, Toni and Carey Nieuwhof, shared lessons on life, leadership, and ministry they have learned over the past 25 years. A conversation on the highlights and insights from the early days of launching Connexus until today, plus a look ahead to the future as we continue to create a church that unchurched people love.
item.content:encoded: Our founders, Toni and Carey Nieuwhof, shared lessons on life, leadership, and ministry they have learned over the past 25 years. A conversation on the highlights and insights from the early days of launching Connexus until today, plus a look ahead to the future as we continue to create a church that unchurched people love.

item.title: What if I Don't Have What it Takes? | Carey Nieuwhof | Cliff Hanger (Part 4)
item.itunes:title: What if I Don't Have What it Takes? | Carey Nieuwhof | Cliff Hanger (Part 4)
item.description:
So you're attracted to the drama in other people's lives but resist it in your own. Agreed. It's so much easier to see the drama than it is to be the drama.

It's also infinitely more disappointing and perhaps unfaithful. Moses knew that first hand. When God called him, he listed five reasons he wanted to stay out of the story. Five reasons he wanted out. He finally relented, and we're still talking about it thousands of years later. Lesson: God could use someone else, but what if you get to do it?¬†
item.content:encoded:
So you're attracted to the drama in other people's lives but resist it in your own. Agreed. It's so much easier to see the drama than it is to be the drama.

It's also infinitely more disappointing and perhaps unfaithful. Moses knew that first hand. When God called him, he listed five reasons he wanted to stay out of the story. Five reasons he wanted out. He finally relented, and we're still talking about it thousands of years later. Lesson: God could use someone else, but what if you get to do it?

item.title: When God Fails You | Carey Nieuwhof | Cliff Hanger (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: When God Fails You | Carey Nieuwhof | Cliff Hanger (Part 3)
item.description:
You probably have a picture of what God should be doing...the way the story should go. Except it never seems to turn out that way. As a result, a lot of people conclude God isn't real, or that God isn't all powerful or all loving. Is it possible to know how to have faith when it feels like God is losing?

But what if, in the very moment you thought God was losing, he's winning? And what if that's true in your life too? You think God is losing...but he's winning.

item.title: I Always Fail God, What Next? | Carey Nieuwhof | Cliff Hanger (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: I Always Fail God, What Next? | Carey Nieuwhof | Cliff Hanger (Part 2)
item.description: From the time you were young, you probably tried to avoid failure. Everyone does. But what if failure is exactly the thing you need to prepare you for what's ahead? So many people think God is absent in failure, but as Joseph learned when he met failure after failure, God is far more present than you think. Which means there's hope for you and for me.
item.content:encoded: From the time you were young, you probably tried to avoid failure. Everyone does. But what if failure is exactly the thing you need to prepare you for what's ahead? So many people think God is absent in failure, but as Joseph learned when he met failure after failure, God is far more present than you think. Which means there's hope for you and for me.

item.title: Is Drama In Life Good or Bad? | Carey Nieuwhof | Cliff Hanger (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: Is Drama In Life Good or Bad? | Carey Nieuwhof | Cliff Hanger (Part 1)
item.description:
Is drama in life good or bad? Every great movie, novel and story features twists, turns, disappointments and failures, which is largely what makes the story gripping. You love it when you don't know what will happen next. ‚Å† ‚Å† Here's the strange part: you're attracted to that kind of drama in other people's lives, but you resist it in your own. ‚Å† ‚Å†

Instead, you long for predictability and stability. You might even wonder if the presence of setbacks and failure in your life is a sign that God has left you. What if nothing could be further from the truth?‚Å†
item.content:encoded:

item.title: How To Achieve Freedom In Your Life | Jeff Brodie | The Road To IÃ∂mÃ∂Perfection (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: How To Achieve Freedom In Your Life | Jeff Brodie | The Road To IÃ∂mÃ∂Perfection (Part 3)
item.description: What does it look like to live freely? What does spiritual freedom even look like? Why do I know I should live one way, but consistently find myself struggling to make a change? A relationship with God isn't just about getting to an eternal destination, but it's about transformation. As you aspire to leave your old roads, paths, and patterns behind and start new patterns that point to Jesus, where do you find the strength you need to make a change in your life? How do you live in freedom? What if God has a way to strengthen you to choose what's best? This week we are talking about the role of the Holy Spirit in our transformation.
item.content:encoded: What does it look like to live freely? What does spiritual freedom even look like? Why do I know I should live one way, but consistently find myself struggling to make a change? A relationship with God isn't just about getting to an eternal destination, but it's about transformation. As you aspire to leave your old roads, paths, and patterns behind and start new patterns that point to Jesus, where do you find the strength you need to make a change in your life? How do you live in freedom? What if God has a way to strengthen you to choose what's best? This week we are talking about the role of the Holy Spirit in our transformation.

item.title: How To Change Your Emotional Patterns | Jeff Brodie | The Road To IÃ∂mÃ∂Perfection (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: How To Change Your Emotional Patterns | Jeff Brodie | The Road To IÃ∂mÃ∂Perfection (Part 2)
item.description: Is there an easy way to master your emotions? When you find yourself in a 'situation' is your first response to respond emotionally or rationally? Think about these for a moment ... What is your response when your boss asks you to work overtime, again, yet they haven't even thanked you for the last time you stayed longer? When you find yourself late for the family photos because your spouse needed to change their outfit one last time to make everything 'perfect', what boils up inside of you? Emotions. The good and the not so great - we all have them. Let's dig into how to control your emotions together.

item.title: What Does It Mean To Follow Jesus? | Jeff Brodie | The Road To IÃ∂mÃ∂Perfection (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: What Does It Mean To Follow Jesus? | Jeff Brodie | The Road To IÃ∂mÃ∂Perfection (Part 1)
item.description: What does it mean to follow Jesus? Is it just about obeying rules and being a good person? Is it becoming the best version of yourself? Is the Christian life only about heaven and hell or is there more to it than that? What is the whole point of life on earth for those who choose Jesus? We'll be sharing God's ultimate goal for your life and what the road to finding it looks like.

item.title: No More Shame | Carey Nieuwhof | Identity Theft (Part 4)
item.itunes:title: No More Shame | Carey Nieuwhof | Identity Theft (Part 4)
item.description: Your desire to blame is an attempt to cover your shame. And there's a lot of shame circulating these days. Most people believe you can't be fully known and fully loved, so they hide and try to make themselves look better so people won't judge them. Jesus comes along with a message of radical acceptance that turned the ancient world‚Äîand this world‚Äîupside down.

Most people believe you can't be fully known and fully loved, so they hide and try to make themselves look better so people won't judge them. Jesus comes along with a message of radical acceptance that turned the ancient world‚Äîand this world‚Äîupside down.

item.title: Blame And Shame Culture | Carey Nieuwhof | Identity Theft (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: Blame And Shame Culture | Carey Nieuwhof | Identity Theft (Part 3)
item.description: When Adam and Eve sinned, the accusations flew, and no one took responsibility. Not only did the blame start, so did the shame. For the first time, Adam and Eve realized they were naked. And they were ashamed. That sounds like a lot of relationships. Mercifully, God clothed them, and later, Jesus clothed all of us with his grace and a call into a new way of life.

item.title: Finding Your Place In The Story | Carey Nieuwhof | Identity Theft (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: Finding Your Place In The Story | Carey Nieuwhof | Identity Theft (Part 2)
item.description: Why is life so hard? That's a great question, and while the answer doesn't take the pain away, it's much easier to understand when you realize that your story, like every story, has a beginning, middle and end. Knowing where you are in your story makes it much easier to understand, accept, trust and even thrive.
item.content:encoded: Why is life so hard? That's a great question, and while the answer doesn't take the pain away, it's much easier to understand when you realize that your story, like every story, has a beginning, middle and end. Knowing where you are in your story makes it much easier to understand, accept, trust and even thrive.

item.title: Why You Aren't Who You Want To Be (And How To Change That) | Carey Nieuwhof
item.itunes:title: Why You Aren't Who You Want To Be (And How To Change That) | Carey Nieuwhof
item.description: Do you ever feel like who you really are was stolen? Like something's missing? You know your life isn't exactly the way it's supposed to be. And neither are you. You have amazing intentions, but you struggle to fulfill them. You fall in love, but mess up the relationship. You get your dream job and it turns into a nightmare. You've met your goal, but there's still a gnawing emptiness. You keep trying, but it never quite works out. What's going on? A journey into the Garden of Eden explains more than you think.
item.content:encoded: Do you ever feel like who you really are was stolen? Like something's missing? You know your life isn't exactly the way it's supposed to be. And neither are you. You have amazing intentions, but you struggle to fulfill them. You fall in love, but mess up the relationship. You get your dream job and it turns into a nightmare. You've met your goal, but there's still a gnawing emptiness. You keep trying, but it never quite works out. What's going on? A journey into the Garden of Eden explains more than you think.

item.title: Finding Connection and Seeing Lives Changed | Jeff Brodie
item.itunes:title: Finding Connection and Seeing Lives Changed | Jeff Brodie
item.description: What would it take for you to be FOR your friends, family and neighbours in this weird season? So much of what we do and how we do it has changed, including the people we interact with. But what if there were ways we could be FOR the people in our lives and cities like never before? What if, we stepped into the corner of those around us in tangible, helpful, and potentially life-changing ways?

item.title: How to Speak with Power - Control Freak - Part 4
item.itunes:title: How to Speak with Power - Control Freak - Part 4
item.description: Do you ever have those moments where you say something and immediately want to take it back? Or you hear your little one repeat something you've said and wish they hadn't? We've all been there. Today we talk about how we can be wise with our words and how our words actually have power.

item.title: Control and Expectations in Relationships | Jeff Brodie | Control Freak (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: Control and Expectations in Relationships | Jeff Brodie | Control Freak (Part 3)
item.description: You struggle with control and expectations in certain relationships. We all do. Have you felt that in your marriage or with your significant other? Do you often want to micro-manage the choices your kids are making? Does it seem like things are spinning out of control at home with everything that's going on? Should you "let go" of something you care so deeply about? Family relationships can be hard, but what God has to say about your relationships can make all the difference. This week we explored how the teachings of scripture point us to a greater purpose in our families than we might see in the moment.

item.title: What To Do When Life Feels Out Of Control | Jeff Brodie | Control Freak (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: What To Do When Life Feels Out Of Control | Jeff Brodie | Control Freak (Part 2)
item.description:
Want to know how to stop worrying and start living? We all face moments when we feel powerless. How should we respond when hardships, calamities, and insults come our way? Our world often tells us that these types of situations are to be avoided or eased at all costs. That we should try to control or escape. But is that the best option?

We will be looking at what scripture has to say about the moments when we feel like things are out of our control.

item.title: How To Stop Being A Control Freak | Jeff Brodie | Control Freak (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: How To Stop Being A Control Freak | Jeff Brodie | Control Freak (Part 1)
item.description:
How do the people around you experience your need for control? Control is really about having power, and how we use that power is important. Who do you have power over? How do you use that power to make a difference in the lives of those around you? Control doesn't inspire people the way influence does. Control makes temporary progress, but it rarely makes a lasting difference.

item.title: How To Ask God For Healing // This Is You (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: How To Ask God For Healing // This Is You (Part 3)
item.description: Healing is something we all look for in our lives at certain moments. Maybe it's physical healing, or divine healing in a relationship, or healing from hurts of the past. What if Jesus wants to bring a greater purpose to your pain? Need a miracle prayer or a prayer for healing?What if Jesus wants to put His power on display through your circumstances? God often works in unexpected ways, but ultimately His goal is to put His power on display by seeing your life changed.

item.title: When You Feel Like You're Alone, You Aren't
item.itunes:title: When You Feel Like You're Alone, You Aren't
item.description:
We all have a story, which Jesus wants to be a part of. He has a purpose for each of our lives. We can sometimes view our mistakes and failures as
obstacles to living out this purpose and experiencing His love and forgiveness. When
Jesus sees us, He doesn't see the sin, but because of what He accomplished on the
cross, He sees us as righteous, pure, clean and innocent.
item.content:encoded: We all have a story, which Jesus wants to be a part of. He has a purpose for each of our lives. We can sometimes view our mistakes and failures as obstacles to living out this purpose and experiencing His love and forgiveness. When Jesus sees us, He doesn't see the sin, but because of what He accomplished on the cross, He sees us as righteous, pure, clean and innocent.

item.title: How To Get Your Life Back On Track - Carey Nieuwhof - Rise of the New Normal - Part 4
item.itunes:title: How To Get Your Life Back On Track - Carey Nieuwhof - Rise of the New Normal - Part 4
item.description: As you build your new normal, what should it look like? It's far too easy to substitute new things that ultimately collapse for old things that collapsed and fail to satisfy you. Ultimately, Jesus, and all that he brings, is the only thing that doesn't collapse when your life does.¬†
item.content:encoded: As you build your new normal, what should it look like? It's far too easy to substitute new things that ultimately collapse for old things that collapsed and fail to satisfy you. Ultimately, Jesus, and all that he brings, is the only thing that doesn't collapse when your life does.

item.title: How To Find Your Identity | Carey Nieuwhof | Rise of The New Normal (Part 3)
item.itunes:title: How To Find Your Identity | Carey Nieuwhof | Rise of The New Normal (Part 3)
item.description: So far in this series, we've seen that not everything you lost was worth keeping, and that trying to build a life around a kingdom without a King can crush you. This week we'll look at what might really have been driving some of what you accumulated in your life prior to COVID, and how to allow God to reset your life around your real identity. Your real identity is one that's received, not achieved.¬†
item.content:encoded: So far in this series, we've seen that not everything you lost was worth keeping, and that trying to build a life around a kingdom without a King can crush you. This week we'll look at what might really have been driving some of what you accumulated in your life prior to COVID, and how to allow God to reset your life around your real identity. Your real identity is one that's received, not achieved.

item.title: Finding Your True Self During Quarantine |Carey Nieuwhof | Rise of The New Normal Part 2
item.itunes:title: Finding Your True Self During Quarantine |Carey Nieuwhof | Rise of The New Normal Part 2
item.description: There's a story widely circulating in the culture. You were born good. Something happened, and your inner self was wounded. To find your true self is your life's purpose and the ultimate pathway to true happiness, satisfaction and pleasure. Any form of difficulty, commitment, push back or restriction is a threat to finding who you're meant to be and your ultimate fulfillment. Throw off all limits and rise against any oppression, and you'll find yourself.

item.title: How Can You Find Your New Normal? | Carey Nieuwhof - What Life Looks Like After the Coronavirus | The Rise of the New Normal - Part 1
item.itunes:title: How Can You Find Your New Normal? | Carey Nieuwhof - What Life Looks Like After the Coronavirus | The Rise of the New Normal - Part 1
item.description: The last 60 days have changed the world and your world like never before. Some of the things you used to put your hope and trust in crumbled overnight.¬† So...what are you left with? Like a garage sale, you might discover in this pandemic that there are some things that used to have great value to you that you just don't want (or need) anymore.¬†

item.itunes:title: Does God Speak to Us Through People? | Jeff Brodie |How To Hear From God - Part 4
item.description: Does God speak to us through people? Can we know how to hear the voice of God clearly? This week, lead pastor Jeff Brodie talks about hearing God's voice by giving godly people permission to speak into your life. This is the final part to our series on how to hear God's voice.¬†

This week, lead pastor Jeff Brodie talks about hearing God's voice by giving godly people permission to speak into your life. This is the final part to our series on how to hear God's voice.

item.title: How Do Regular People Experience God? | Jeff Brodie - Hearing From God - Part 3
item.itunes:title: How Do Regular People Experience God? | Jeff Brodie - Hearing From God - Part 3
item.description: When people say they hear from God, it can often feel like something foreign or even a bit odd. Do regular people hear from God? Who is the Holy Spirit and what does He have to do with hearing God speak? In this week's message, we looked at the role of the Holy Spirit in our lives - specifically how the Holy Spirit can help us to hear God's voice in our lives. Let's continue the journey of using this time to hear God's voice more clearly than ever before.

item.title: Why Don't I Hear God Speak To Me? ‚Å†| Jeff Brodie | Hearing From God - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Why Don't I Hear God Speak To Me? ‚Å†| Jeff Brodie | Hearing From God - Part 2
item.description: How do you know if God is speaking to you? Is it even possible to know how to hear God's voice? ‚Å† You get a gut feeling, you hear a whisper, you feel a desire come up in your soul ‚Ä¶ is that God speaking to you? How do you know it's not just your own voice? Or maybe you pray and pray and never hear anything. Does that mean God's voice doesn't have anything to say to you? Is there a bible teaching that shows how to hear the voice of God?

item.title: How Can You Hear God Speak? Jeff Brodie - Hearing From God Part 1
item.itunes:title: How Can You Hear God Speak? Jeff Brodie - Hearing From God Part 1
item.description: The world is full of noise vying for your attention every day, but you rarely think about it. Who are the voices you listen to most? What about the voice of God? Do you hear His voice at all? If He spoke, would you know it's Him? Or maybe it's just something you ate. We'll be looking at what the voice of God sounds like and how you can use solitude to begin to hear it.

item.itunes:title: Baptism Sunday - 2020

item.itunes:title: Relationship Advice for Breakups - Love, Dates and Heartbreaks - Part 4
item.description: Looking for relationship advice for breakups? We all have hopes and dreams, but what are we supposed to do when our hearts are broken and our dreams can't come true? It's tempting to take matters into our own hands, but is there a better way?

item.description: From elementary school through high school, many of us had ideas of what the perfect relationship would look like in the future. While those dreams may not represent our current reality, a step in the right direction could be to follow the apostle Paul's advice‚Äîmove from our childish ways and start being grownups.

item.title: The Key To Having A Great Relationship | Andy Stanley | Love Dates & Heartbreaks Part 2
item.itunes:title: The Key To Having A Great Relationship | Andy Stanley | Love Dates & Heartbreaks Part 2
item.description: If becoming the right kind of person is key to a great relationship, how do you do that? Is there something you can do to prepare? Does it just happen? Sure, we're supposed to love others, but what does that really mean? Let's lean in and read the fine print.

item.itunes:title: Do You REALLY Know Yourself? - Self Awareness & the Enneagram
item.description:
So...why isn't everyone a little more like you? The world would be a better place, would it not? Apparently, not. When God designed humankind, he pronounced his work to be very good. However, as the Enneagram reveals, He didn't make us all the same. Maybe the differences aren't deficiencies, they're design.¬†

item.title: What Do You Do With A Gift You Don't Deserve? The Unsettling Solution For Just About Everything - Part 2 with Andy Stanley
item.itunes:title: What Do You Do With A Gift You Don't Deserve? The Unsettling Solution For Just About Everything - Part 2 with Andy Stanley
item.description: The kingdom of God is characterized by unsettling generosity ‚Äîthe kind of generosity that gives the undeserving what they don't deserve and regardless of how unright we've been, makes us right with God. So what do we do when we're faced with this math that doesn't add up? And how do we respond to this unfair, unsettling system that Jesus came to invite us into?

item.title: New Christmas Series with Andy Stanley - One Thing That Could Radically Change Your Christmas Season
item.itunes:title: New Christmas Series with Andy Stanley - One Thing That Could Radically Change Your Christmas Season
item.description: There is an unsettling solution for just about everything, and we can sum it up in one word. Grace. It's the undeserved, unearned, unearnable favor that Jesus came to offer us. So why wouldn't we want Christianity to be true? And where should you start if it's a word that was never part of the equation for you?

item.title: What is Heaven Like? - Part 3 of What Happens When You Die? with Carey Nieuwhof
item.itunes:title: What is Heaven Like? - Part 3 of What Happens When You Die? with Carey Nieuwhof
item.description: So if you're going to live forever, what's it like? This week, we'll look at the biblical descriptions of heaven, what role Jesus plays, what role your deeds play (they do play a role, just not the one most people think), and we'll answer your top questions on heaven as submitted through Instagram.¬†
item.content:encoded: So if you're going to live forever, what's it like? This week, we'll look at the biblical descriptions of heaven, what role Jesus plays, what role your deeds play (they do play a role, just not the one most people think), and we'll answer your top questions on heaven as submitted through Instagram.

item.title: Near Death Experiences and 3 Stories of People Who Came Back From The Dead - A conversation with Carey Nieuwhof
item.itunes:title: Near Death Experiences and 3 Stories of People Who Came Back From The Dead - A conversation with Carey Nieuwhof
item.description: A lot of people struggle to believe what they read in Scripture. Instead, they argue that they'd be more likely to believe if someone came back from the dead and told them about what happens when you die. This week we'll look at the stories of three people who did just that.¬†
item.content:encoded: A lot of people struggle to believe what they read in Scripture. Instead, they argue that they'd be more likely to believe if someone came back from the dead and told them about what happens when you die. This week we'll look at the stories of three people who did just that.

item.title: What Happens When You Die? New Series with Carey Nieuwhof
item.itunes:title: What Happens When You Die? New Series with Carey Nieuwhof
item.description: Almost everyone has an opinion about the afterlife, but so many things people believe about eternity may or may not be true. How do you know whether what you think is true...is true? To kick off the series, Carey covers five commonly held myths about eternity that it's time to bust.¬†
item.content:encoded: Almost everyone has an opinion about the afterlife, but so many things people believe about eternity may or may not be true. How do you know whether what you think is true...is true? To kick off the series, Carey covers five commonly held myths about eternity that it's time to bust.

item.title: Resilience in the Midst of Worry - Jeff Brodie - Bulletproof - Part 3
item.itunes:title: Resilience in the Midst of Worry - Jeff Brodie - Bulletproof - Part 3
item.description: In your life, when the gap between the real and the ideal is growing, you can end up filling that gap with worry, anxiety, and fear. If you are honest, sometimes your worry about all the possible outcomes is worse than the situation itself. The truth: Worry erodes resilience. How do you maintain your resilience in the face of worry and anxiety. What if you could face hard things while winning the war against worry at the same time?
item.content:encoded: In your life, when the gap between the real and the ideal is growing, you can end up filling that gap with worry, anxiety, and fear. If you are honest, sometimes your worry about all the possible outcomes is worse than the situation itself. The truth: Worry erodes resilience. How do you maintain your resilience in the face of worry and anxiety. What if you could face hard things while winning the war against worry at the same time?

item.title: Get Resilience in Relationships
item.itunes:title: Get Resilience in Relationships
item.description: One of the things that rattles us most are difficult relationships. Sometimes we need resilience when people are difficult, and sometimes we need to keep fighting for a relationship with someone we love. Often we need resilience to navigate a relationship we didn't choose (like a co-worker or a neighbour). How do we bounce back when the gap grows between the reality of a relationship and the ideal that we would hope for? With conflict being a big part of relational challenges, how do we keep our composure? As we look at Paul's life the answer may not be what we think.
item.content:encoded: One of the things that rattles us most are difficult relationships. Sometimes we need resilience when people are difficult, and sometimes we need to keep fighting for a relationship with someone we love. Often we need resilience to navigate a relationship we didn't choose (like a co-worker or a neighbour). How do we bounce back when the gap grows between the reality of a relationship and the ideal that we would hope for? With conflict being a big part of relational challenges, how do we keep our composure? As we look at Paul's life the answer may not be what we think.

item.title: What does it mean to be resilient? Bulletproof Part 1 - Jeff Brodie
item.itunes:title: What does it mean to be resilient? Bulletproof Part 1 - Jeff Brodie
item.description:
When it comes to most circumstances and relationships in your life you have an ideal in mind or your own idea of how it should go (even subconsciously). The problem comes when the gap between the real and the ideal begins to grow, especially when it's something or someone you care about. That's when you are shaken. How do you grow in resilience to handle those gaps?

¬†
