The problem comes when the gap between the real and the ideal begins to grow, especially when it's something or someone you care about. That's when you are shaken. How do you grow in resilience to handle those gaps?

item.title: Add, Follow, Block - Part 4
item.itunes:title: Add, Follow, Block - Part 4
item.description: As much as there are some things we should delete in our lives, there are some things that should never be blocked.¬† In fact, they need to be saved, added and followed. Pursued. We'll look at the kinds of things--and the kinds of people--you want to always have close to you.
item.content:encoded: As much as there are some things we should delete in our lives, there are some things that should never be blocked. In fact, they need to be saved, added and followed. Pursued. We'll look at the kinds of things--and the kinds of people--you want to always have close to you.

item.title: Add, Follow, Block - Part 3 - Toxic People
item.itunes:title: Add, Follow, Block - Part 3 - Toxic People
item.description: Can you follow Jesus and delete toxic people from your life?¬† Surprisingly, yes. In fact, sometimes it's the most loving thing you can do. Join us to find out why, when, how to delete toxic people from your life. You might even discover who needs to go.¬†
item.content:encoded: Can you follow Jesus and delete toxic people from your life? Surprisingly, yes. In fact, sometimes it's the most loving thing you can do. Join us to find out why, when, how to delete toxic people from your life. You might even discover who needs to go.

item.title: Me and My Big Mouth - Part 4 - Right Where You Want 'Em
item.itunes:title: Me and My Big Mouth - Part 4 - Right Where You Want 'Em
item.description: What goes around often comes around. The powerless often find themselves in a position of power and the people who hurt us may someday need us. In the moments when we've got those people right where we want 'em, what we say will say as much about us as anything else. If our words are stones, will we choose to throw them, or use them to pave the way forward?
item.content:encoded: What goes around often comes around. The powerless often find themselves in a position of power and the people who hurt us may someday need us. In the moments when we've got those people right where we want 'em, what we say will say as much about us as anything else. If our words are stones, will we choose to throw them, or use them to pave the way forward?

item.title: Me and My Big Mouth - Part 3 - According to Code
item.itunes:title: Me and My Big Mouth - Part 3 - According to Code
item.description: Our big mouths can be destructive, but they also have the power to build others up. What we say can impact the quality, and even the direction, of the lives of the people around us. How can we use this power for good?
item.content:encoded: Our big mouths can be destructive, but they also have the power to build others up. What we say can impact the quality, and even the direction, of the lives of the people around us. How can we use this power for good?

item.title: Me and My Big Mouth - Part 2 - Untameable
item.itunes:title: Me and My Big Mouth - Part 2 - Untameable
item.description: Like a small spark that has the potential to scorch an entire green forest, our tongues are untamable, with the power to control our whole bodies. We have a tool that can be used to build up those around us or tear them down in just a few words. What do we do with that kind of power? We can't lock it away. But we can, by God's grace, learn to control it.
item.content:encoded: Like a small spark that has the potential to scorch an entire green forest, our tongues are untamable, with the power to control our whole bodies. We have a tool that can be used to build up those around us or tear them down in just a few words. What do we do with that kind of power? We can't lock it away. But we can, by God's grace, learn to control it.

item.title: Me and My Big Mouth - Part 1 - Quick to Listen
item.itunes:title: Me and My Big Mouth - Part 1 - Quick to Listen
item.description: We all know what it's like to be hurt by someone who just couldn't listen long enough to understand us. Maybe in their attempt to be right, they damaged a relationship that could have been saved with a little patience and curiosity. You've probably been on the other side of that coin too. Taking the verbal offense may have won the argument but you lost relationally. What if we didn't settle for being right, but tried to make things right instead? The longer we listen the more we learn, and the better chance we have of protecting ourselves from our own big mouths.

item.title: To Be List - Part 3 - Time for Some Me-Time
item.itunes:title: To Be List - Part 3 - Time for Some Me-Time
item.description: You have a million things on the go, and because you don't want to be selfish, chances are you put everything and everyone ahead of yourself. That's potentially a fatal mistake. Maybe the key to being a better follower of Jesus, a better spouse, a better parent and a better human is actually putting yourself first when it comes to personal growth.¬†

item.title: To Be List - Part 2 - The Subtle Art of Selling Your Soul
item.itunes:title: To Be List - Part 2 - The Subtle Art of Selling Your Soul
item.description: Whatever your sense of morality is, the frightening truth is that we all fail to live up to it? Why...and how do you keep coming up short? Surprisingly, compromise never starts with the big stuff. It's way more subtle than that. When you see how compromise starts, you can change it.

item.title: To Be List - Part 1 - Meanwhile, At Your Funeral...
item.itunes:title: To Be List - Part 1 - Meanwhile, At Your Funeral...
item.description:
Carey Nieuwhof

To Be List - Part 1 - Meanwhile, At Your Funeral...

As much as no one likes to talk about it, one day we're all going to not be here anymore. So here's the socially awkward question: what will people be saying about you at your funeral? After doing hundreds of funerals, pastors have a pretty good idea of what people say at funerals. And that's the question we'll look at this weekend is what will people say about you? It's not that hard to predict.¬†

item.title: See The World - Part 4 - Tragedy
item.itunes:title: See The World - Part 4 - Tragedy
item.description:
Levi Lusko

When we face pain and loss, they change the story we had planned for our lives. They can end our dreams. But what do pain and loss look like when we try to see the world as God sees the world, and to do as God says?

Levi Lusko

When we face pain and loss, they change the story we had planned for our lives. They can end our dreams. But what do pain and loss look like when we try to see the world as God sees the world, and to do as God says?

item.title: See The World - Part 3 - Time
item.itunes:title: See The World - Part 3 - Time

Andy Stanley

We tend to view our time the same way we view our money‚Äîwe spend, invest, and waste it. The question is:¬†how does God view time?¬†If we saw it as he sees it, it might affect the way we use our own.

item.itunes:title: See The World - Part 2 - Money

Seeing your money and possessions as God sees them will make you more inclined to do with them as God says. That can revolutionize your life.

item.title: See The World - Part 1 - Invite an Interruption
item.itunes:title: See The World - Part 1 - Invite an Interruption
item.description:
Clay Scroggins

How you see the world affects everything you do. It even affects how you see God. What would it take for you to broaden your view so you can see God more accurately and connect with him more deeply?
item.content:encoded:
Clay Scroggins

How you see the world affects everything you do. It even affects how you see God. What would it take for you to broaden your view so you can see God more accurately and connect with him more deeply?

item.title: Dream Job - Part 3 - Keeping the Dream Alive
item.itunes:title: Dream Job - Part 3 - Keeping the Dream Alive
item.description:
Jeff Henderson

What do you do when you feel stuck at work? You're grateful you have a job, but you feel like there's something else you need to be doing. How do you pay the bills and still pursue a dream job? Many people give up. You don't have to be one of those people. In the conclusion of¬†Dream Job, we talk about what to do in the middle of the Monday-morning blues and the search for your dream job.¬†
item.content:encoded:
Jeff Henderson

What do you do when you feel stuck at work? You're grateful you have a job, but you feel like there's something else you need to be doing. How do you pay the bills and still pursue a dream job? Many people give up. You don't have to be one of those people. In the conclusion of Dream Job, we talk about what to do in the middle of the Monday-morning blues and the search for your dream job.

item.title: Dream Job - Part 2 - Now Hiring
item.itunes:title: Dream Job - Part 2 - Now Hiring
item.description:
Jeff Henderson

Once we understand the purpose of work, we have to understand the answer to another important question: "What does God specifically want me to do with my career?" This question sounds similar to a question we all were asked as kids: "What do you want to be when you grow up?" For many of us, these questions seem mysterious.¬†The good news is that in Part 2 of¬†Dream Job, we will look at a tangible biblical principle that puts us on the path toward discovering the answer.
item.content:encoded:
Jeff Henderson

Once we understand the purpose of work, we have to understand the answer to another important question: "What does God specifically want me to do with my career?" This question sounds similar to a question we all were asked as kids: "What do you want to be when you grow up?" For many of us, these questions seem mysterious. The good news is that in Part 2 of Dream Job, we will look at a tangible biblical principle that puts us on the path toward discovering the answer.

item.title: Dream Job - Part 1 - 9 to 5 with Purpose
item.itunes:title: Dream Job - Part 1 - 9 to 5 with Purpose
item.description:
Jeff Henderson

Many¬†of¬†us spend over 30% of our lives at a¬†job¬†and, according to Gallup, almost 80% of us are dissatisfied while we're there. That's rather depressing, isn't it? We'll spend almost a third of our lives on something that creates dissatisfaction.¬†Are we okay with this?

Perhaps we need to hit the reset button and rediscover what "work" is all about and where it came from. When we do, we discover something remarkable: the idea that work came from our heavenly Father.¬†It's his¬†idea. And when we understand work from God's perspective, we discover the real meaning and purpose behind it.

When we discover the purpose of work, we discover that there is no such thing as a¬†job¬†without purpose.¬†This means that all of us can experience something remarkable: a¬†job¬†with purpose, meaning, and satisfaction. In other words, a¬†dream¬†job.¬†
item.content:encoded:
Jeff Henderson

Many of us spend over 30% of our lives at a job and, according to Gallup, almost 80% of us are dissatisfied while we're there. That's rather depressing, isn't it? We'll spend almost a third of our lives on something that creates dissatisfaction. Are we okay with this?

Perhaps we need to hit the reset button and rediscover what "work" is all about and where it came from. When we do, we discover something remarkable: the idea that work came from our heavenly Father. It's his idea. And when we understand work from God's perspective, we discover the real meaning and purpose behind it.

When we discover the purpose of work, we discover that there is no such thing as a job without purpose. This means that all of us can experience something remarkable: a job with purpose, meaning, and satisfaction. In other words, a dream job.

item.title: Baptism Sunday 2019
item.itunes:title: Baptism Sunday 2019
item.description: What a morning to celebrate how Jesus has changed people's lives and their choice to follow Him. It's amazing to see what God is doing. Baptism is also a time for all of us to reflect on the death and resurrection of Jesus, and celebrate the freedom He brings us.
item.content:encoded: What a morning to celebrate how Jesus has changed people's lives and their choice to follow Him. It's amazing to see what God is doing. Baptism is also a time for all of us to reflect on the death and resurrection of Jesus, and celebrate the freedom He brings us.

item.title: Undrink The Koolaid - Part 4
item.itunes:title: Undrink The Koolaid - Part 4
item.description: How can you tell what's right and what's wrong? ¬†Fortunately, many would say, we live in an age where objective truth has disappeared. What's true for you isn't true for others, and what's wrong for you isn't wrong for others. But is it truly good for us when morals change from generation to generation and you can write your own? Or, are we missing something?
item.content:encoded: How can you tell what's right and what's wrong? Fortunately, many would say, we live in an age where objective truth has disappeared. What's true for you isn't true for others, and what's wrong for you isn't wrong for others. But is it truly good for us when morals change from generation to generation and you can write your own? Or, are we missing something?

item.title: Undrink The Koolaid - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Undrink The Koolaid - Part 2
item.description: Why would anyone living today trust the Bible? After all, it's so full of terrible instances of violence and oppression that it has to be both barbaric and outdated. Besides, you can't really rely on a document that's over 2000 years old. It's been translated so often there's very little likelihood that what we're reading is what was written. Right?

item.title: Undrink The Koolaid - Part 1
item.itunes:title: Undrink The Koolaid - Part 1
item.description: Religion is basically how ancients understood the world, but science has taken us so far beyond that. Between what we know about evolution, astronomy, genetics, biology and so many other sciences, we've explained what we used to attribute to God. If science explains or will explain everything, why do we really need God?
item.content:encoded: Religion is basically how ancients understood the world, but science has taken us so far beyond that. Between what we know about evolution, astronomy, genetics, biology and so many other sciences, we've explained what we used to attribute to God. If science explains or will explain everything, why do we really need God?

item.title: Easter Sunday 2019
item.itunes:title: Easter Sunday 2019
item.description: We celebrated the incredible hope of the resurrection of Jesus at our Easter services and it was a powerful morning! Tune in for to catch our online experience of this service.
item.content:encoded: We celebrated the incredible hope of the resurrection of Jesus at our Easter services and it was a powerful morning! Tune in for to catch our online experience of this service.

item.title: Good Friday 2019
item.itunes:title: Good Friday 2019
item.description: We've hosted a meaningful Good Friday services across all locations that included a reflection on the death of Christ and an opportunity to mark the moment with communion. These services are a little different and are always a special time.
item.content:encoded: We've hosted a meaningful Good Friday services across all locations that included a reflection on the death of Christ and an opportunity to mark the moment with communion. These services are a little different and are always a special time.

item.title: Alt Kingdom - Part 6
item.itunes:title: Alt Kingdom - Part 6
item.description: Most of people either feel not very good about themselves or too good about themselves. Both are problems. And both are rooted in something sinister that Jesus would love to root out of your life. Once it's gone, a much better understanding of what true success is can emerge.
item.content:encoded: Most of people either feel not very good about themselves or too good about themselves. Both are problems. And both are rooted in something sinister that Jesus would love to root out of your life. Once it's gone, a much better understanding of what true success is can emerge.

item.title: Alt Kingdom - Part 5
item.itunes:title: Alt Kingdom - Part 5
item.description: So how do you know you're good with God? How deeply do you have to obey? How often can you mess up? If you blow it, will God give up on you? Will he be mad at you? Will he punish you? These are good questions...but only religious people ask them. Christians ask a whole other set of questions, and Jesus shows us why.
item.content:encoded: So how do you know you're good with God? How deeply do you have to obey? How often can you mess up? If you blow it, will God give up on you? Will he be mad at you? Will he punish you? These are good questions...but only religious people ask them. Christians ask a whole other set of questions, and Jesus shows us why.

item.title: Alt Kingdom - Part 4
item.itunes:title: Alt Kingdom - Part 4
item.description: It's so easy to worry, and if you're honest, it probably seems a little annoying when Jesus tells you to simply stop worrying (which he does). The real questions is how? We'll look at what Jesus says the chief causes of worry are, and what to do about them.
item.content:encoded: It's so easy to worry, and if you're honest, it probably seems a little annoying when Jesus tells you to simply stop worrying (which he does). The real questions is how? We'll look at what Jesus says the chief causes of worry are, and what to do about them.

item.title: It's just a Phase - Part 4
item.itunes:title: It's just a Phase - Part 4
item.description: Family life comes with decisions and challenges every day. How we see and approach our families is important, but there's also some everyday practical stuff. How do you tackle screen time, bedtime, dating, when do they get a phone, how do you manage their behaviour - this list could go on! On this week we had a panel of parents at different phases to answer the tough questions and have a conversation about the everyday challenges, opportunities, and rhythms of family.
item.content:encoded: Family life comes with decisions and challenges every day. How we see and approach our families is important, but there's also some everyday practical stuff. How do you tackle screen time, bedtime, dating, when do they get a phone, how do you manage their behaviour - this list could go on! On this week we had a panel of parents at different phases to answer the tough questions and have a conversation about the everyday challenges, opportunities, and rhythms of family.

item.title: It's Just a Phase - Part 3
item.itunes:title: It's Just a Phase - Part 3
item.description: Statistics say that the three biggest factors in building a faith that lasts in the life of a child are the spiritual investment of a parent, the outside voices of other adults, and the opportunity for that child to find a personal mission. That's why having a family rhythm of faith and having outside voices speaking into your family are so important. That's why a partnership with a church is so important for every family. This week, we're looking at exactly what that could look like for you.
item.content:encoded: Statistics say that the three biggest factors in building a faith that lasts in the life of a child are the spiritual investment of a parent, the outside voices of other adults, and the opportunity for that child to find a personal mission. That's why having a family rhythm of faith and having outside voices speaking into your family are so important. That's why a partnership with a church is so important for every family. This week, we're looking at exactly what that could look like for you.

item.title: It's Just a Phase - Part 2
item.itunes:title: It's Just a Phase - Part 2
item.description: The honest truth is that every family fights. Some fight hot and others fight cold. Conflict is a part of family life. Is it possible to fight in a way that honours our family and our God? What if we started to think about fighting for our family instead of with our family? What if we started to fight for the heart of our family by inspiring them by living out a faith of adventure? What would that look like?
item.content:encoded: The honest truth is that every family fights. Some fight hot and others fight cold. Conflict is a part of family life. Is it possible to fight in a way that honours our family and our God? What if we started to think about fighting for our family instead of with our family? What if we started to fight for the heart of our family by inspiring them by living out a faith of adventure? What would that look like?

item.title: It's Just a Phase - Part 1
item.itunes:title: It's Just a Phase - Part 1
item.description: No matter what phase your family is in, you've discovered one thing...though the days can feel long, the years really are short. From sleepless nights to managing screen time to an empty nest, figuring out family life isn't easy and the truth is that every phase seems to be different. How do you thrive in the phase you are in today and be sure that you are headed in the right direction in the long-term? In this series, we'll be talking about strategies to navigate the pressures of family, timeless principles that apply to parenting, and discover the hope that, no matter your phase of life, God may be writing a bigger story in your family than you think.
item.content:encoded: No matter what phase your family is in, you've discovered one thing...though the days can feel long, the years really are short. In this series, we'll be talking about strategies to navigate the pressures of family, timeless principles that apply to parenting, and discover the hope that, no matter your phase of life, God may be writing a bigger story in your family than you think.

item.title: Alt Kingdom - Part 3
item.itunes:title: Alt Kingdom - Part 3
item.description: It's easy to love your friends, but it's almost impossible to love your enemies. Which is exactly why Jesus tells you to do just that. One of the defining characteristics of people who follow Jesus should be love for their enemies. If you think it's impossible to do that, think again.
item.content:encoded: It's easy to love your friends, but it's almost impossible to love your enemies. Which is exactly why Jesus tells you to do just that. One of the defining characteristics of people who follow Jesus should be love for their enemies. If you think it's impossible to do that, think again.

item.title: Alt Kingdom - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Alt Kingdom - Part 2
item.description: If you really want to get countercultural, just look at Jesus' teachings on sex, marriage and adultery. Almost nobody believes that stuff anymore. Except for Jesus. When it comes to Jesus' alternative teachings on sex and relationships, maybe it's not just a question of what he's longing to save you from. Maybe it's a question of what Jesus is trying to save you for.
item.content:encoded: If you really want to get countercultural, just look at Jesus' teachings on sex, marriage and adultery. Almost nobody believes that stuff anymore. Except for Jesus. When it comes to Jesus' alternative teachings on sex and relationships, maybe it's not just a question of what he's longing to save you from. Maybe it's a question of what Jesus is trying to save you for.

item.title: Alt Kingdom - Part 1
item.itunes:title: Alt Kingdom - Part 1
item.description: Well known. Poorly applied. That's an accurate way of describing so many of Jesus' teachings, including his teachings on anger. Some people think Jesus was just spouting hyperbole. Actually, he was ushering in His Alt Kingdom. We'll start this journey with Jesus' teachings on anger. If you think you have a right to be angry, think again.
item.content:encoded: Well known. Poorly applied. That's an accurate way of describing so many of Jesus' teachings, including his teachings on anger. Some people think Jesus was just spouting hyperbole. Actually, he was ushering in His Alt Kingdom. We'll start this journey with Jesus' teachings on anger. If you think you have a right to be angry, think again.

item.title: End Of The World - Part 4
item.itunes:title: End Of The World - Part 4
item.description: It's one thing to know how everything turns out and to decide for the side of good and the side of God, but it's another thing to make it until then. In the meantime, suffering remains‚Äîcancer, addictions, broken relationships, conflict, tragedy. Is personal anxiety, stress and fear always bound to be on the rise? In this final week of the series, we'll share a critical key to navigating the personal suffering that seems inevitable in this world.
item.content:encoded: It's one thing to know how everything turns out and to decide for the side of good and the side of God, but it's another thing to make it until then. In the meantime, suffering remains‚Äîcancer, addictions, broken relationships, conflict, tragedy. Is personal anxiety, stress and fear always bound to be on the rise? In this final week of the series, we'll share a critical key to navigating the personal suffering that seems inevitable in this world.

item.title: End Of The World - Part 3
item.itunes:title: End Of The World - Part 3
item.description: It's great to know how things end, but in the meantime, what's with evil? So often evil seems to be winning, and so many people are angry at God for letting that happens. It's a good point. If God is so loving, why does he allow so much evil and suffering? While that question is difficult to answer convincingly, God does something more spectacular and powerful with evil. Eventually, evil self-destructs. And when evil throws itself at God, he does something unbelievable with it.
item.content:encoded: It's great to know how things end, but in the meantime, what's with evil? So often evil seems to be winning, and so many people are angry at God for letting that happens. It's a good point. If God is so loving, why does he allow so much evil and suffering? While that question is difficult to answer convincingly, God does something more spectacular and powerful with evil. Eventually, evil self-destructs. And when evil throws itself at God, he does something unbelievable with it.

item.title: End Of The World - Part 2
item.itunes:title: End Of The World - Part 2
item.description: So what exactly will happen next? Will we blow ourselves up? Will AI take over and turn us into a sub-species? Will climate change wipe us out? Will God allow any of this, or will he protect the people he loves and we'll magically work it all out? Jesus has a lot to say about what's coming, and with it, extends a powerful invitation.
item.content:encoded: So what exactly will happen next? Will we blow ourselves up? Will AI take over and turn us into a sub-species? Will climate change wipe us out? Will God allow any of this, or will he protect the people he loves and we'll magically work it all out? Jesus has a lot to say about what's coming, and with it, extends a powerful invitation.

item.title: End Of The World - Part 1
item.itunes:title: End Of The World - Part 1
item.description: Most of us hold the idea that the future will always get better...that somehow we will figure this out. But the question is, can we? Is this even true? We'll look at two ancient stories that tell us more about ourselves than most of us want to admit, and realize why the struggle apart from God is more futile than we think. Are people inherently good, or a mixed bag? Is there a limit to human progress? And if we're so enlightened, why do we keep almost destroying ourselves again and again?
item.content:encoded: Most of us hold the idea that the future will always get better...that somehow we will figure this out. But the question is, can we? Is this even true? We'll look at two ancient stories that tell us more about ourselves than most of us want to admit, and realize why the struggle apart from God is more futile than we think. Are people inherently good, or a mixed bag? Is there a limit to human progress? And if we're so enlightened, why do we keep almost destroying ourselves again and again?

item.title: This Is My Year
item.itunes:title: This Is My Year
item.description: The New Year is full of possibilities that fuel the potential for a better future. That's why we make resolutions . . . even though those resolutions often fall by the wayside. But there's something simple you can do to make the most of this year. It begins by looking past what you think is possible in your life to what God thinks is possible.
item.content:encoded: The New Year is full of possibilities that fuel the potential for a better future. That's why we make resolutions . . . even though those resolutions often fall by the wayside. But there's something simple you can do to make the most of this year. It begins by looking past what you think is possible in your life to what God thinks is possible.

item.title: Christmas Eve 2018
item.itunes:title: Christmas Eve 2018
item.description: At Christmas, you can expect to see God, just not the God you expected. Maybe you've written off Jesus, Christianity or even Christmas, thinking it can't possibly help you. Think again. Join us as Connexus Church hosts Christmas Eve In The City 2018, an evening of music, cheer and a message the whole family will love.
item.content:encoded: At Christmas, you can expect to see God, just not the God you expected. Maybe you've written off Jesus, Christianity or even Christmas, thinking it can't possibly help you. Think again. Join us as Connexus Church hosts Christmas Eve In The City 2018, an evening of music, cheer and a message the whole family will love.

item.title: Welcome To Wonderland - Part 3
item.itunes:title: Welcome To Wonderland - Part 3
item.description: We all wonder. When we fix our eyes somewhere other than on God, wonder leads to wander. If you've wandered from the faith or are looking for the door, it's not because of Jesus. It's probably because you've fixed your eyes on people, institutions, or a religion based on following rules. You may think Christianity requires mind-numbing, experience-denying faith, but what if that's not true?
item.content:encoded: We all wonder. When we fix our eyes somewhere other than on God, wonder leads to wander. If you've wandered from the faith or are looking for the door, it's not because of Jesus. It's probably because you've fixed your eyes on people, institutions, or a religion based on following rules. You may think Christianity requires mind-numbing, experience-denying faith, but what if that's not true?

item.title: Welcome To Wonderland - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Welcome To Wonderland - Part 2
item.description: We wonder because our frame of reference doesn't provide us with all of the answers. Every version of religion works for children. But then life happens. We experience challenging circumstances that sow doubt in our childhood faith. Tragedy causes us to question if God is good and loving. Sin leads to guilt and shame. We wonder if God can really love us. Is there such a thing as a frame of reference that can accomodate a grown-up faith?
item.content:encoded: We wonder because our frame of reference doesn't provide us with all of the answers. Every version of religion works for children. But then life happens. We experience challenging circumstances that sow doubt in our childhood faith. Tragedy causes us to question if God is good and loving. Sin leads to guilt and shame. We wonder if God can really love us. Is there such a thing as a frame of reference that can accomodate a grown-up faith?

item.title: Welcome To Wonderland - Part 1
item.itunes:title: Welcome To Wonderland - Part 1
item.description: We all have a framework that helps us make sense out of life. It helps us make decisions that make sense. But we wonder about some things because our frame of reference doesn't provide all the answers.
item.content:encoded: We all have a framework that helps us make sense out of life. It helps us make decisions that make sense. But we wonder about some things because our frame of reference doesn't provide all the answers.

item.title: The Struggle Is Real - Part 4
item.itunes:title: The Struggle Is Real - Part 4
item.description: And then there's parenting. You're a parent forever, but believe it or not, no matter how young your kids are now, there's a day when your kids WILL leave home. The question is, what do you focus on to make sure your kids have what they need to launch into life? There are so many things competing for your attention and their attention, but there's one thing that matters most.
item.content:encoded: And then there's parenting. You're a parent forever, but believe it or not, no matter how young your kids are now, there's a day when your kids WILL leave home. The question is, what do you focus on to make sure your kids have what they need to launch into life? There are so many things competing for your attention and their attention, but there's one thing that matters most.

item.title: The Struggle Is Real - Part 3
item.itunes:title: The Struggle Is Real - Part 3
item.description: Dating is more complicated than it's ever been, but that doesn't mean it's impossible. Whether you're single by choice or wishing you weren't, what does God have to say to about navigating life without a partner? Surprisingly, the scripture has a very positive view of being single.
item.content:encoded: Dating is more complicated than it's ever been, but that doesn't mean it's impossible. Whether you're single by choice or wishing you weren't, what does God have to say to about navigating life without a partner? Surprisingly, the scripture has a very positive view of being single.

item.title: The Struggle Is Real - Part 2
item.itunes:title: The Struggle Is Real - Part 2
item.description: Your life was going just fine...until you saw someone else's. Funny how that happens. A little more than a decade into smartphones and social media feels more like social misery. You look at someone else's life/marriage/relationships/kids/job and it makes you...miserable. This week we'll look at why comparison is the thief of joy, and the path Jesus shows you to find much more contentment.
item.content:encoded: Your life was going just fine...until you saw someone else's. Funny how that happens. A little more than a decade into smartphones and social media feels more like social misery. You look at someone else's life/marriage/relationships/kids/job and it makes you...miserable. This week we'll look at why comparison is the thief of joy, and the path Jesus shows you to find much more contentment.

item.title: The Struggle Is Real - Part 1
item.itunes:title: The Struggle Is Real - Part 1
item.description: You may not have it all together, but at least pastors have it all together, right? In this message, Carey and Toni Nieuwhof talk openly about the struggles and tough seasons they've come through in their marriage. Things haven't been nearly as easy as they thought they would be, but they've been worth it. Carey and Toni will talk about how they got through the hard times to find the love they worried had been lost.
item.content:encoded: You may not have it all together, but at least pastors have it all together, right? Things haven't been nearly as easy as they thought they would be, but they've been worth it. Carey and Toni will talk about how they got through the hard times to find the love they worried had been lost.

item.title: Crazy Like Us - Part 3
item.itunes:title: Crazy Like Us - Part 3
item.description: Generosity requires a plan. But how do you make a plan? These two simple gauges will help you decide where and how much to give.
item.content:encoded: Generosity requires a plan. But how do you make a plan? These two simple gauges will help you decide where and how much to give.

item.title: Crazy Like Us - Part 2
item.itunes:title: Crazy Like Us - Part 2
item.description: You know how to give. Everyone gives something somewhere. We define our generosity by our random acts of goodness. But generosity is more than that. Generosity is the premeditated, calculated, designated emancipation of personal financial assets.
item.content:encoded: You know how to give. Everyone gives something somewhere. We define our generosity by our random acts of goodness. But generosity is more than that. Generosity is the premeditated, calculated, designated emancipation of personal financial assets.

item.title: Crazy Like Us - Part 1 - You Just Think You Are
item.itunes:title: Crazy Like Us - Part 1 - You Just Think You Are
item.description: Everyone gives something somewhere. But there's a difference between random acts of giving and true generosity. The good news is, it's possible to learn how to be generous.
item.content:encoded: Everyone gives something somewhere. But there's a difference between random acts of giving and true generosity. The good news is, it's possible to learn how to be generous.

item.title: Didn't See It Coming - Part 5 - Burnout
item.itunes:title: Didn't See It Coming - Part 5 - Burnout
item.description: Burnout seems to almost be an epidemic these days. And a surprising number of people who perhaps haven't fully burned out still test positive for the signs of burnout. We'll look at what causes burnout, how to know you're in it and how to get back. Plus we'll touch on suicide and why the voices you may be hearing are lying.
item.content:encoded: Burnout seems to almost be an epidemic these days. And a surprising number of people who perhaps haven't fully burned out still test positive for the signs of burnout. We'll look at what causes burnout, how to know you're in it and how to get back. Plus we'll touch on suicide and why the voices you may be hearing are lying.

item.title: Didn't See It Coming - Part 4 - Emptiness
item.itunes:title: Didn't See It Coming - Part 4 - Emptiness
item.description: So many people get surprised by something that generation after generation of successful people encounter: success is emptier than they ever dreamed. Even when all your dreams come true, you may feel grateful. But feeling grateful doesn't leave you full? Why does success feel so empty? We'll look at why that is, and what to do about it.
item.content:encoded: So many people get surprised by something that generation after generation of successful people encounter: success is emptier than they ever dreamed. Even when all your dreams come true, you may feel grateful. But feeling grateful doesn't leave you full? Why does success feel so empty? We'll look at why that is, and what to do about it.

item.title: BONUS EPISODE - Carey Nieuwhof interviews Author and Pastor Erwin McManus on Pride
item.itunes:title: BONUS EPISODE - Carey Nieuwhof interviews Author and Pastor Erwin McManus on Pride
item.description: In a wide-ranging conversation, Carey talks to author, futurist, film-maker, designer and pastor Erwin McManus about his childhood, how he got over his need for approval, why narcissism is so prevalent in leadership (including how to spot a narcissist)
item.content:encoded: In a wide-ranging conversation, Carey talks to author, futurist, film-maker, designer and pastor Erwin McManus about his childhood, how he got over his need for approval, why narcissism is so prevalent in leadership (including how to spot a narcissist)

item.title: Didn't See It Coming - Part 3 - Pride
item.itunes:title: Didn't See It Coming - Part 3 - Pride
item.description: Most people think pride is a problem narcissists struggle with. What if they're wrong? What if pride is bigger than that? What if most pride springs not from narcissism, but from insecurity. As strange as it might sound, your insecurity may be driving your pride and causing you all kind of problems that you can easily solve if you overcome your insecurity. We'll show you how. ¬†
item.content:encoded: Most people think pride is a problem narcissists struggle with. What if they're wrong? What if pride is bigger than that? What if most pride springs not from narcissism, but from insecurity. As strange as it might sound, your insecurity may be driving your pride and causing you all kind of problems that you can easily solve if you overcome your insecurity. We'll show you how.

item.title: Didn't See It Coming - Part 2 - Disconnection
item.itunes:title: Didn't See It Coming - Part 2 - Disconnection
item.description: We've never been more connected as a culture, and we've never felt more alone. Many experts are beginning to call loneliness a cultural epidemic. Why is it that we can have 500 friends on social media and feel so utterly alone? A devious disconnect is underway in our culture, and it's not just a tech problem...it's a human problem.
item.content:encoded: We've never been more connected as a culture, and we've never felt more alone. Many experts are beginning to call loneliness a cultural epidemic. Why is it that we can have 500 friends on social media and feel so utterly alone? A devious disconnect is underway in our culture, and it's not just a tech problem...it's a human problem.

item.title: Didn't See It Coming - Part 1 - Kicking Cynicism in the Teeth
item.itunes:title: Didn't See It Coming - Part 1 - Kicking Cynicism in the Teeth
item.description: You never thought you'd be a cynic, did you? Nobody wants to be cynical, but so many people end up there. Why? Cynicism starts not because you don't care, but because you do. Surprisingly, most cynics are former optimists. We'll look at how cynicism starts, how to recognize it and how to stop it.
item.content:encoded: You never thought you'd be a cynic, did you? Nobody wants to be cynical, but so many people end up there. Why? Cynicism starts not because you don't care, but because you do. Surprisingly, most cynics are former optimists. We'll look at how cynicism starts, how to recognize it and how to stop it.

item.title: Double Vision - Part 2 - Who Is On Your Mat?
item.itunes:title: Double Vision - Part 2 - Who Is On Your Mat?
item.description: Jesus had double vision. He has the ability to see God's image in us and our brokenness at the same time. Seeing people this way is what moved his heart to reach out to people every day and he was ridiculed for it. But what about other people through scripture? How did they see people with double vision and how did they respond?
item.content:encoded: Jesus had double vision. He has the ability to see God's image in us and our brokenness at the same time. Seeing people this way is what moved his heart to reach out to people every day and he was ridiculed for it. But what about other people through scripture? How did they see people with double vision and how did they respond?

item.title: Double Vision - Part 1 - The Beauty and the Brokenness
item.itunes:title: Double Vision - Part 1 - The Beauty and the Brokenness
item.description: Jesus had double vision. He has the ability to see God's image in us and our brokenness at the same time. Seeing people this way is what moved Jesus' heart to reach out to people every day and he was consequently ridiculed for it. But he saw us and loved us to the point that his rescue mission took Him to the cross. What would happen in our hearts and lives if we had that same double vision?
item.content:encoded: Jesus had double vision. He has the ability to see God's image in us and our brokenness at the same time. Seeing people this way is what moved Jesus' heart to reach out to people every day and he was consequently ridiculed for it. But he saw us and loved us to the point that his rescue mission took Him to the cross. What would happen in our hearts and lives if we had that same double vision?

item.title: On The Neck of Kings - Part 3 - Flip Your Fear
item.itunes:title: On The Neck of Kings - Part 3 - Flip Your Fear
item.description: So is fear always bad? Actually there's one kind of fear you should have. We'll look at a powerful scriptural teaching that shows you how flipping your fear can increase your confidence and reduce your worry.
item.content:encoded: So is fear always bad? Actually there's one kind of fear you should have. We'll look at a powerful scriptural teaching that shows you how flipping your fear can increase your confidence and reduce your worry.

item.title: On The Neck Of Kings - Part 2 - Talk To Your Soul
item.itunes:title: On The Neck Of Kings - Part 2 - Talk To Your Soul
item.description: What do you do when you start worrying? Is there anyway to quell the anxiety and find peace? Surprisingly there is. Thousands of years ago, the ancients adopted a practice that still works today. This Sunday, Carey will share how to talk to your soul...and settle it down.
item.content:encoded: What do you do when you start worrying? Is there anyway to quell the anxiety and find peace? Surprisingly there is. Thousands of years ago, the ancients adopted a practice that still works today. This Sunday, Carey will share how to talk to your soul...and settle it down.

item.title: On The Neck of Kings - Part 1 - Worst Case Scenario
item.itunes:title: On The Neck of Kings - Part 1 - Worst Case Scenario
item.description: So often our fears take us into a worst case scenario. What if I lose my job? What if she leaves me? What if everything falls apart? What if I get an incurable disease and die? Joshua and the nation of Israel discovered that God loves to do what everyone thought was impossible, and in the process they discovered that too often we stress over a battle that's already been won.
item.content:encoded: So often our fears take us into a worst case scenario. What if I lose my job? What if she leaves me? What if everything falls apart? What if I get an incurable disease and die? Joshua and the nation of Israel discovered that God loves to do what everyone thought was impossible, and in the process they discovered that too often we stress over a battle that's already been won.

item.title: Guardrails - Part 5 - The Heart of the Matter
item.itunes:title: Guardrails - Part 5 - The Heart of the Matter
item.description: It's vital to erect guardrails around our hearts because an unguarded heart can overpower our most guarded behavior.
item.content:encoded: It's vital to erect guardrails around our hearts because an unguarded heart can overpower our most guarded behavior.

item.title: Guardrails - Part 4 - Money Matters
item.itunes:title: Guardrails - Part 4 - Money Matters
item.description: When it comes to our finances, it's easy to cross the line into the danger zone. That's why it's essential to establish guardrails against greed.
item.content:encoded: When it comes to our finances, it's easy to cross the line into the danger zone. That's why it's essential to establish guardrails against greed.

item.title: Guardrails - Part 3 - Forever Yours
item.itunes:title: Guardrails - Part 3 - Forever Yours
item.description: Guardrails keep vehicles from straying into dangerous or off limit areas. We need personal guardrails so we don't stray into areas of life that can harm us or the people we love. If there's one area in which personal guardrails are most needed but also most resisted, it's in our relationships.
item.content:encoded: Guardrails keep vehicles from straying into dangerous or off limit areas. We need personal guardrails so we don't stray into areas of life that can harm us or the people we love. If there's one area in which personal guardrails are most needed but also most resisted, it's in our relationships.

item.title: Guardrails - Part 2 - Proximity
item.itunes:title: Guardrails - Part 2 - Proximity
item.description: Guardrails are designed to keep vehicles from straying into dangerous or off-limit areas. They minimize damage by keeping us in the safety zone. But the highway isn't the only place we need guardrails.
item.content:encoded: Guardrails are designed to keep vehicles from straying into dangerous or off-limit areas. They minimize damage by keeping us in the safety zone. But the highway isn't the only place we need guardrails.

item.title: Guardrails - Part 1 - Direct and Protect
item.itunes:title: Guardrails - Part 1 - Direct and Protect
item.description: Guardrails are designed to keep vehicles from straying into dangerous or off-limit areas. They minimize damage by keeping us in the safety zone. But the highway isn't the only place we need guardrails.
item.content:encoded: Guardrails are designed to keep vehicles from straying into dangerous or off-limit areas. They minimize damage by keeping us in the safety zone. But the highway isn't the only place we need guardrails.

item.title: Your New Default - Part 4 - Blame to Responsibility
item.itunes:title: Your New Default - Part 4 - Blame to Responsibility
item.description: Blame. It damages marriages, destroys partnerships, harms teams and twists relationships.¬† None of us like to get blamed, but somehow most of us still find ways to blame others.¬† Why do we do that?¬† What would life be like if we stopped blaming others?¬† What would it do to your faith, your friendships, your family? How would you get there?
item.content:encoded: Blame. It damages marriages, destroys partnerships, harms teams and twists relationships. None of us like to get blamed, but somehow most of us still find ways to blame others. Why do we do that? What would life be like if we stopped blaming others? What would it do to your faith, your friendships, your family? How would you get there?

item.title: Your New Default - Part 3 - Anger to Gratitude
item.itunes:title: Your New Default - Part 3 - Anger to Gratitude
item.description: In a world of outrage, it's easy to be angry. Whether your anger shows up in private, public or whether it's just something you feel but rarely show, what's underneath that? We'll look at where your anger comes from, how to deal with it, and how to replace it with a profound gratitude.
item.content:encoded: In a world of outrage, it's easy to be angry. Whether your anger shows up in private, public or whether it's just something you feel but rarely show, what's underneath that? We'll look at where your anger comes from, how to deal with it, and how to replace it with a profound gratitude.

item.title: Your New Default - Part 2 - Suspicion to Trust
item.itunes:title: Your New Default - Part 2 - Suspicion to Trust
item.description: Remember when you were a kid and trusted at a level that seemed, well, childlike?¬† But our trust gets broken. Over time, we become suspicious of people, organizations and even God.¬† What happens to us when suspicion becomes our dominant view? Everything changes when you stop assuming the worst, and start believing the best.
item.content:encoded: Remember when you were a kid and trusted at a level that seemed, well, childlike? But our trust gets broken. Over time, we become suspicious of people, organizations and even God. What happens to us when suspicion becomes our dominant view? Everything changes when you stop assuming the worst, and start believing the best.

item.title: Off the Chain - Part 4 - Baptism Sunday
item.itunes:title: Off the Chain - Part 4 - Baptism Sunday
item.description: What a morning to celebrate how Jesus has changed people's lives and their choice to follow Him. It's amazing to see what God is doing. Baptism is also a time for all of us to reflect on the death and resurrection of Jesus, and celebrate the freedom He brings us.
item.content:encoded: What a morning to celebrate how Jesus has changed people's lives and their choice to follow Him. It's amazing to see what God is doing. Baptism is also a time for all of us to reflect on the death and resurrection of Jesus, and celebrate the freedom He brings us.

item.title: Off The Chain - Part 2 - My Soul Is Free... But Then I...
item.itunes:title: Off The Chain - Part 2 - My Soul Is Free... But Then I...
item.description: I know that true freedom is found in Jesus. It's amazing that He has made a way for us to experience a loving relationship with God. At the same time, I don't always feel like I'm living in freely in my day to day life - I give into temptation, lose my temper, fall into bad habits, get overwhelmed, etc. How do I experience this freedom as I live my life each day?
item.content:encoded: I know that true freedom is found in Jesus. It's amazing that He has made a way for us to experience a loving relationship with God. At the same time, I don't always feel like I'm living in freely in my day to day life - I give into temptation, lose my temper, fall into bad habits, get overwhelmed, etc. How do I experience this freedom as I live my life each day?

item.title: Off The Chain - Part 1 - Free Trade
item.itunes:title: Off The Chain - Part 1 - Free Trade
item.description: We live in a culture where we've never had more options to choose from, but in many ways, we also feel chained down by those same choices. We can feel the pressure that comes from being tied to our job, to a broken relationship, to our past, to our financial situation, to inner battles, etc. No matter how hard we try, why is it so hard to feel free in our daily lives? We'll be talking about what it means to experience real freedom in our souls and lives. What if it really is possible to live free?
item.content:encoded: We live in a culture where we've never had more options to choose from, but in many ways, we also feel chained down by those same choices. We can feel the pressure that comes from being tied to our job, to a broken relationship, to our past, to our financial situation, to inner battles, etc. No matter how hard we try, why is it so hard to feel free in our daily lives? We'll be talking about what it means to experience real freedom in our souls and lives. What if it really is possible to live free?

item.title: Invisible God - Part 6 - When You Speak To God
item.itunes:title: Invisible God - Part 6 - When You Speak To God
item.description: To wrap up this series, we'll look at how you can talk with God. From ancient times, people have called this practice prayer. We'll look at how prayer is different from meditation, what prayer changes, and how prayer can become part of your daily life.
item.content:encoded: To wrap up this series, we'll look at how you can talk with God. From ancient times, people have called this practice prayer. We'll look at how prayer is different from meditation, what prayer changes, and how prayer can become part of your daily life.

item.title: Easter Sunday - Invisible God - Part 2 - Breakfast on the Beach
item.itunes:title: Easter Sunday - Invisible God - Part 2 - Breakfast on the Beach
item.description: Love sees who you really are and sticks around anyway. And that's exactly what Jesus did. In the days after his resurrection from the dead, Jesus surprised his disciples by making them breakfast on the beach. To their utter shock, it was the beginning of a whole new relationship. Jesus wasn't finished with them (or with you). He was just getting started.
item.content:encoded: Love sees who you really are and sticks around anyway. And that's exactly what Jesus did. In the days after his resurrection from the dead, Jesus surprised his disciples by making them breakfast on the beach. To their utter shock, it was the beginning of a whole new relationship. Jesus wasn't finished with them (or with you). He was just getting started.

item.title: Good Friday - Invisible God - Part 1 - Last Meal
item.itunes:title: Good Friday - Invisible God - Part 1 - Last Meal
item.description: Love sees who you really are and sticks around anyway. And that's exactly what Jesus did. In the days after his resurrection from the dead, Jesus surprised his disciples by making them breakfast on the beach. To their utter shock, it was the beginning of a whole new relationship. Jesus wasn't finished with them (or with you). He was just getting started.

In the days after his resurrection from the dead, Jesus surprised his disciples by making them breakfast on the beach. To their utter shock, it was the beginning of a whole new relationship.
