item.title: Compassion Sunday 2018
item.itunes:title: Compassion Sunday 2018
item.description: Sometimes you think you can't make a dent in the problems the world is facing. And besides, you feel like you barely have enough to live on yourself. As a result, many of us often feel indifferent toward the situation others face, and our response is usually a response of inaction. Is there another way? Can something make a difference?
item.content:encoded: Sometimes you think you can't make a dent in the problems the world is facing. And besides, you feel like you barely have enough to live on yourself. As a result, many of us often feel indifferent toward the situation others face, and our response is usually a response of inaction. Is there another way? Can something make a difference?

item.title: What Happy Couples Know - Part 4 - It's a Choice
item.itunes:title: What Happy Couples Know - Part 4 - It's a Choice
item.description: Happy couples decide they owe each other everything but are owed nothing in return. But that requires effort. Every married person makes a choice every day. That choice feels more like a reaction, so most people don't think they have a choice at all. But they do. Happy couples make the happy choice.
item.content:encoded: Happy couples decide they owe each other everything but are owed nothing in return. But that requires effort. Every married person makes a choice every day. That choice feels more like a reaction, so most people don't think they have a choice at all. But they do. Happy couples make the happy choice.

item.title: What Happy Couples Know - Part 3 - Sometimes You Have To Throw Things
item.itunes:title: What Happy Couples Know - Part 3 - Sometimes You Have To Throw Things
item.description: As long as you think your spouse owes you, your marriage will be all about keeping score. That destroys intimacy. It destroys love. But what are we supposed to do about our hopes, dreams, and desires?
item.content:encoded: As long as you think your spouse owes you, your marriage will be all about keeping score. That destroys intimacy. It destroys love. But what are we supposed to do about our hopes, dreams, and desires?

item.title: The Problem of God - Part 6 - The Problem of Exclusivity
item.itunes:title: The Problem of God - Part 6 - The Problem of Exclusivity
item.description: I owe you eliminates I love you.
item.content:encoded: I owe you eliminates I love you.

item.title: The Problem of God - Part 5 - The Problem of Sex
item.itunes:title: The Problem of God - Part 5 - The Problem of Sex
item.description: One of the reasons people don't like Christianity is because of what the scripture teaches about sex. So what is the deal with sex? Why does God seem so uptight about it? Or are we just getting it wrong?
item.content:encoded: One of the reasons people don't like Christianity is because of what the scripture teaches about sex. So what is the deal with sex? Why does God seem so uptight about it? Or are we just getting it wrong?

item.title: The Problem of God - Part 4 - The Problem of Hypocrisy
item.itunes:title: The Problem of God - Part 4 - The Problem of Hypocrisy
item.description: From the Christian down the road who never practices what he preaches, to witch hunts, to the crusades, what is the deal with Christians who look nothing like Jesus? You told us that the hypocrisy of Christians is one of the top problems you have with God. So let's go there.
item.content:encoded: From the Christian down the road who never practices what he preaches, to witch hunts, to the crusades, what is the deal with Christians who look nothing like Jesus? You told us that the hypocrisy of Christians is one of the top problems you have with God. So let's go there.

item.title: The Problem of God - Part 3 - The Problem of Evil and Suffering
item.itunes:title: The Problem of God - Part 3 - The Problem of Evil and Suffering
item.description: Here's the question millions of people have asked: God is good and if God is all-powerful, why is there suffering? Every world religion and worldview (including atheism and agnosticism) has to answer that question. Christianity has an unbelievably different kind of answer that almost everyone misses.
item.content:encoded: Here's the question millions of people have asked: God is good and if God is all-powerful, why is there suffering? Every world religion and worldview (including atheism and agnosticism) has to answer that question. Christianity has an unbelievably different kind of answer that almost everyone misses.

item.title: The Problem of God - Part 2 - The Problem of Science
item.itunes:title: The Problem of God - Part 2 - The Problem of Science
item.description: So many people believe there's an irreconcilable tension between science and Christianity. If you become a Christian, you can't embrace science. If you embrace science, you can't have faith. What if faith and reason aren't enemies, but friends?
item.content:encoded: So many people believe there's an irreconcilable tension between science and Christianity. If you become a Christian, you can't embrace science. If you embrace science, you can't have faith. What if faith and reason aren't enemies, but friends?

item.title: The Problem of God - Part 1 - The Problem of God's Existence
item.itunes:title: The Problem of God - Part 1 - The Problem of God's Existence
item.description: So maybe you think that to believe in God requires a giant leap of faith. And maybe you think that essentially, there's zero evidence for God's existence apart from the Bible. Is that true? Is there any evidence for God outside of scripture or blind belief? We'll explore those questions in part one of The Problem of God.
item.content:encoded: So maybe you think that to believe in God requires a giant leap of faith. And maybe you think that essentially, there's zero evidence for God's existence apart from the Bible. Is that true? Is there any evidence for God outside of scripture or blind belief? We'll explore those questions in part one of The Problem of God.

item.title: Preventative Circles
item.itunes:title: Preventative Circles
item.description: Why is it some people go through extraordinarily tough times and are broken, while others are not? Check out this secret to weathering the storms of life.
item.content:encoded: Why is it some people go through extraordinarily tough times and are broken, while others are not? Check out this secret to weathering the storms of life.

item.title: Fresh Eyes - Part 1 - Mary's Eyes
item.itunes:title: Fresh Eyes - Part 1 - Mary's Eyes
item.description: The Christmas story is a strange one, and for Mary, it really didn't make sense at all. Which is exactly what can give you hope when your story doesn't make sense.
item.content:encoded: The Christmas story is a strange one, and for Mary, it really didn't make sense at all. Which is exactly what can give you hope when your story doesn't make sense.

item.title: Me Monster - Part 4 - Insecure Monster
item.itunes:title: Me Monster - Part 4 - Insecure Monster
item.description: Surprisingly, selfishness isn't always a product of narcissism or pure ego. Often it's the product of insecurity. The me-monster inside of you won't die because you're so worried you don't measure up, that you're not enough, and as a result, you really don't like yourself. Which is why you can't stop thinking about yourself. And it's damaging your relationships, your parenting and even your performance at work.
item.content:encoded: Surprisingly, selfishness isn't always a product of narcissism or pure ego. Often it's the product of insecurity. The me-monster inside of you won't die because you're so worried you don't measure up, that you're not enough, and as a result, you really don't like yourself. Which is why you can't stop thinking about yourself. And it's damaging your relationships, your parenting and even your performance at work.

item.title: Me Monster - Part 3 - Money Monster
item.itunes:title: Me Monster - Part 3 - Money Monster
item.description: We all dream of being rich enough to give money away, but what if that day never comes? After all, right now you have bills to pay, mouths to feed and debts to pay off. What if generous living had nothing to do with how much you make, but with what you do with what you make?
item.content:encoded: We all dream of being rich enough to give money away, but what if that day never comes? After all, right now you have bills to pay, mouths to feed and debts to pay off. What if generous living had nothing to do with how much you make, but with what you do with what you make?

item.title: Me Monster - Part 2 - Love Monster
item.itunes:title: Me Monster - Part 2 - Love Monster
item.description: He's supposed to complete you, and she's everything you've been looking for. The power in a relationship comes from what you get from someone, right? Maybe that's exactly why you can't find the satisfaction you're looking for.
item.content:encoded: He's supposed to complete you, and she's everything you've been looking for. The power in a relationship comes from what you get from someone, right? Maybe that's exactly why you can't find the satisfaction you're looking for.

item.title: Me Monster - Part 1 - The Monster Inside
item.itunes:title: Me Monster - Part 1 - The Monster Inside
item.description: There's a monster inside most of us‚Äîa me-monster, and it's rarely satisfied. It always wants a little more, makes demands of others, wants to take, not give and thinks about what it can get out of anything. The monster screams 'feed me', so you do, but it's never satisfied. What do you do with it?
item.content:encoded: There's a monster inside most of us‚Äîa me-monster, and it's rarely satisfied. It always wants a little more, makes demands of others, wants to take, not give and thinks about what it can get out of anything. The monster screams 'feed me', so you do, but it's never satisfied. What do you do with it?

item.title: Breathing Room - Part 4 - Choosing to Cheat
item.itunes:title: Breathing Room - Part 4 - Choosing to Cheat
item.description:
At some point in our attempts to get the most out of life, we lose control of our lives. We try to force one more thing in to our already busy lives and we reach a breaking point. Too much pressure causes an emotional breakdown. Too much debt causes a financial breakdown. Or maybe you're on the verge of a breakdown in your relationships.

What do you do when your worklife is so full you don't have time for the people who matter most?
item.content:encoded: At some point in our attempts to get the most out of life, we lose control of our lives. We try to force one more thing in to our already busy lives and we reach a breaking point. Too much pressure causes an emotional breakdown. Too much debt causes a financial breakdown. Or maybe you're on the verge of a breakdown in your relationships. What do you do when your worklife is so full you don't have time for the people who matter most?

item.title: Breathing Room - Part 2 - Time
item.itunes:title: Breathing Room - Part 2 - Time
item.description: We're all busy. Our schedules are packed with career, family, friends, church, and other responsibilities. Sometimes our days are so full that we don't enjoy¬†anything¬†because we're trying to do¬†everything. Our relationship with God and with others benefits when we create breathing room in our schedules. But where do we start?
item.content:encoded: We're all busy. Our schedules are packed with career, family, friends, church, and other responsibilities. Sometimes our days are so full that we don't enjoy anything because we're trying to do everything. Our relationship with God and with others benefits when we create breathing room in our schedules. But where do we start?

item.title: Breathing Room - Part 3 - Dollars and Sense
item.itunes:title: Breathing Room - Part 3 - Dollars and Sense
item.description:
We live in a culture that continually tells us to pursue a higher standard of living in order to improve our quality of life. But "standard of living" and "quality of life" aren't the same thing. One has to do with the stuff we accumulate. The other is about the peace we experience regardless of our circumstances.

What if your pursuit of a standard of living is undermining your quality of life?
item.content:encoded: We live in a culture that continually tells us to pursue a higher standard of living in order to improve our quality of life. But "standard of living" and "quality of life" aren't the same thing. One has to do with the stuff we accumulate. The other is about the peace we experience regardless of our circumstances. What if your pursuit of a standard of living is undermining your quality of life?

item.title: Breathing Room - Part 1 - Ex-Squeeze Yourself
item.itunes:title: Breathing Room - Part 1 - Ex-Squeeze Yourself
item.description:
Our lives are busy and fast-paced. The lack of margin increases our stress and shortens our tempers. It can distract us from the most important things in our lives . . . and our relationships suffer. It can even affect our relationship with God because there's a connection between our willingness to create margin and our faith.

Life is better with breathing room.
item.content:encoded: Our lives are busy and fast-paced. The lack of margin increases our stress and shortens our tempers. It can distract us from the most important things in our lives . . . and our relationships suffer. It can even affect our relationship with God because there's a connection between our willingness to create margin and our faith. Life is better with breathing room.

item.title: The Great Escape - Part 4 - Still Running
item.itunes:title: The Great Escape - Part 4 - Still Running
item.description: Sometimes your running is over, but if you're really honest, you're still mad. We meet Jonah at the end of the story, and he's angry. Angry at God, angry at life. You can run away from God, but as we'll see, for some strange reason, God doesn't run away from runaways.
item.content:encoded: Sometimes your running is over, but if you're really honest, you're still mad. We meet Jonah at the end of the story, and he's angry. Angry at God, angry at life. You can run away from God, but as we'll see, for some strange reason, God doesn't run away from runaways.

item.title: The Great Escape - Part 3 - Mad at Mercy
item.itunes:title: The Great Escape - Part 3 - Mad at Mercy
item.description: So what does God do with runaways? Especially stubborn ones who have adopted a lifestyle that completely dishonours him? He loves them. So many people who run from God think God is mad at them. God may be angry at the running, but he loves runners.
item.content:encoded: So what does God do with runaways? Especially stubborn ones who have adopted a lifestyle that completely dishonours him? He loves them. So many people who run from God think God is mad at them. God may be angry at the running, but he loves runners.

item.title: The Great Escape - Part 2 - No Escape
item.itunes:title: The Great Escape - Part 2 - No Escape
item.description: You can try to escape God, but your escapism actually provides no escape. We meet Jonah as Jonah meets a sovereign God who traps him. Trying to escape God is futile, but we try anyway, don't we?
item.content:encoded: You can try to escape God, but your escapism actually provides no escape. We meet Jonah as Jonah meets a sovereign God who traps him. Trying to escape God is futile, but we try anyway, don't we?

item.title: The Great Escape - Part 1 - 1,000 Reasons
item.itunes:title: The Great Escape - Part 1 - 1,000 Reasons
item.description: At some level, all of us are running from something. Your past. The future. Your job. Your family. God. There are 1000 reasons to want to escape. Any idea what you're running from? And why? ¬†
item.content:encoded: At some level, all of us are running from something. Your past. The future. Your job. Your family. God. There are 1000 reasons to want to escape. Any idea what you're running from? And why?

item.title: Tough As Nails - Part 3 - Our Once Upon A Time
item.itunes:title: Tough As Nails - Part 3 - Our Once Upon A Time
item.description: Once upon a time, Jesus stood against the injustice of the Roman empire and the hypocrisy of religious leaders. He changed the course of human history.¬†What will our¬†Once upon a time‚Ä¶¬†story be?
item.content:encoded: Once upon a time, Jesus stood against the injustice of the Roman empire and the hypocrisy of religious leaders. He changed the course of human history. What will our Once upon a time‚Ä¶ story be?

item.title: Tough As Nails - Part 2 - Fix Your Eyes
item.itunes:title: Tough As Nails - Part 2 - Fix Your Eyes
item.description: What if our faith was characterized by fearlessness, humility, confidence in Jesus, and love of others? Imagine how that would change the world around us.
item.content:encoded: What if our faith was characterized by fearlessness, humility, confidence in Jesus, and love of others? Imagine how that would change the world around us.

item.title: Tough As Nails - Part 1 - In The Beginning
item.itunes:title: Tough As Nails - Part 1 - In The Beginning
item.description: We see daily news reports about violence and terrorism. The world can feel like a dangerous place. Surrounded by uncertainty, it's difficult not to be afraid. But Jesus offers us another option.
item.content:encoded: We see daily news reports about violence and terrorism. The world can feel like a dangerous place. Surrounded by uncertainty, it's difficult not to be afraid. But Jesus offers us another option.

item.title: What's The Point? - Part 4 - Dream Team
item.itunes:title: What's The Point? - Part 4 - Dream Team
item.description: Our culture celebrates autonomy. Not needing to go to any more meetings. Not needing to answer the phone. Having enough money and enough health that you can do exactly what you want to do, when you want to do it. But what if your fulfillment is not found in isolation, but actually playing a part in something greater than yourself? What if there were a multitude of people waiting, hoping that you would play your part?
item.content:encoded: Our culture celebrates autonomy. Not needing to go to any more meetings. Not needing to answer the phone. Having enough money and enough health that you can do exactly what you want to do, when you want to do it. But what if your fulfillment is not found in isolation, but actually playing a part in something greater than yourself? What if there were a multitude of people waiting, hoping that you would play your part?

item.title: What's The Point? - Part 3 - Just A Job
item.itunes:title: What's The Point? - Part 3 - Just A Job
item.description:
70% of people admit to being disengaged at work. ¬†That includes people who got their dream job, only to discover it was hardly a dream. Why is work so frustrating? And how can you spend your time and energy in ways that are far more fulfilling? God has something fairly radical to say about work that could completely change your attitude and your satisfaction.

¬†
item.content:encoded: 70% of people admit to being disengaged at work. That includes people who got their dream job, only to discover it was hardly a dream. Why is work so frustrating? And how can you spend your time and energy in ways that are far more fulfilling? God has something fairly radical to say about work that could completely change your attitude and your satisfaction.

item.title: What's The Point? - Part 2 - Made For This
item.itunes:title: What's The Point? - Part 2 - Made For This
item.description: Sometimes it's hard to know what you should really be doing with your life. Other times the trajectory of your life can be clear but it doesn't have the meaning you hoped for. What were you put on this earth to do? What if discovering more of who God made you to be, can help you discover more of His purposes for you?
item.content:encoded: Sometimes it's hard to know what you should really be doing with your life. Other times the trajectory of your life can be clear but it doesn't have the meaning you hoped for. What were you put on this earth to do? What if discovering more of who God made you to be, can help you discover more of His purposes for you?

item.title: What's The Point? - Part 1 - Meaningless Separation
item.itunes:title: What's The Point? - Part 1 - Meaningless Separation
item.description: So you probably think the angst you feel in life some days will get better if you were more gifted, or you had money or fame. Most people find just the opposite‚Äîthe more you have, the less fulfilled you feel. Why is that? Why is it that some of the most gifted people are the most miserable. And where does your dis-satisfaction come from?
item.content:encoded: So you probably think the angst you feel in life some days will get better if you were more gifted, or you had money or fame. Most people find just the opposite‚Äîthe more you have, the less fulfilled you feel. Why is that? Why is it that some of the most gifted people are the most miserable. And where does your dis-satisfaction come from?

item.title: Address The Mess - Part 5 - Messy-er
item.itunes:title: Address The Mess - Part 5 - Messy-er
item.description: When you have a mess to address, first options aren't usually the best options. First options often make messes messier. In this message, Andy explores an approach that can take the -er out of your messy situations.
item.content:encoded: When you have a mess to address, first options aren't usually the best options. First options often make messes messier. In this message, Andy explores an approach that can take the -er out of your messy situations.

item.title: Address The Mess - Part 4 - Move Toward The Mess
item.itunes:title: Address The Mess - Part 4 - Move Toward The Mess
item.description: Jesus told us to love our neighbors as ourselves. But that's easier said than done. What are the limits of our responsibility to others? The answer may surprise you.
item.content:encoded: Jesus told us to love our neighbors as ourselves. But that's easier said than done. What are the limits of our responsibility to others? The answer may surprise you.

item.title: Address the Mess - Part 3 - Inside Out
item.itunes:title: Address the Mess - Part 3 - Inside Out
item.description: A common misperception is that the Christian life is all about avoiding messes and staying out of trouble. But following Jesus isn't about avoiding something; it's about becoming something.
item.content:encoded: A common misperception is that the Christian life is all about avoiding messes and staying out of trouble. But following Jesus isn't about avoiding something; it's about becoming something.

item.title: Address the Mess - Part 2 - Best Mess Ever
item.itunes:title: Address the Mess - Part 2 - Best Mess Ever
item.description: I know a mess when I see one because I am a mess. When we acknowledge our messes, we're a baby step away from acknowledging God. Your mess has the potential to bring God near you.
item.content:encoded: I know a mess when I see one because I am a mess. When we acknowledge our messes, we're a baby step away from acknowledging God. Your mess has the potential to bring God near you.

item.title: Address The Mess - Part 1 - The Mess in the Mirror
item.itunes:title: Address The Mess - Part 1 - The Mess in the Mirror
item.description: Whether we're religious or not, we've all been in, are in, or are only one decision away from a mess. But there's a powerful connection between your messes and your relationship with God.
item.content:encoded: Whether we're religious or not, we've all been in, are in, or are only one decision away from a mess. But there's a powerful connection between your messes and your relationship with God.

item.title: Don't Be Weird - Part 3 - Conversation Killer
item.itunes:title: Don't Be Weird - Part 3 - Conversation Killer
item.description: Every week you spend time with people who don't know Jesus, and opportunities to have a conversation come up. How exactly do you have a good conversation with someone about your faith? How do you start and what do you even say? Jesus gives us a few examples of conversations he had with people on the journey to faith. Let's look at his example of how to have a truth and grace filled conversation about faith.
item.content:encoded: Every week you spend time with people who don't know Jesus, and opportunities to have a conversation come up. How exactly do you have a good conversation with someone about your faith? How do you start and what do you even say? Jesus gives us a few examples of conversations he had with people on the journey to faith. Let's look at his example of how to have a truth and grace filled conversation about faith.

item.title: Don't Be Weird - Part 2 - Trust Issues
item.itunes:title: Don't Be Weird - Part 2 - Trust Issues
item.description:
In a culture where people are spiritually curious, they are looking for people who are willing to have open and honest conversations. At the same time, it can be difficult to understand someone's journey to Jesus. When does God show up in someone's life? How do we play a role in that? How do we trust God to show up? How do they trust us as a safe person to help them on their journey?

¬†
item.content:encoded: In a culture where people are spiritually curious, they are looking for people who are willing to have open and honest conversations. At the same time, it can be difficult to understand someone's journey to Jesus. When does God show up in someone's life? How do we play a role in that? How do we trust God to show up? How do they trust us as a safe person to help them on their journey?

item.title: Don't Be Weird - Part 1 - Misdiagnosis
item.itunes:title: Don't Be Weird - Part 1 - Misdiagnosis
item.description: If you've ever met a Christian, you know that we aren't always good at talking about what we believe. If you are a Christian, you may have experienced how talking about your relationship with Jesus can feel weird, scary, or just make you feel incompetent. What if you could change that? We'll see how Jesus and early Christians had spiritual conversations in a culture where it was taboo, and how sharing your faith is easier than you think.
item.content:encoded: If you've ever met a Christian, you know that we aren't always good at talking about what we believe. If you are a Christian, you may have experienced how talking about your relationship with Jesus can feel weird, scary, or just make you feel incompetent. What if you could change that? We'll see how Jesus and early Christians had spiritual conversations in a culture where it was taboo, and how sharing your faith is easier than you think.

item.title: Better Plotline - Part 4 - Still Hungry
item.itunes:title: Better Plotline - Part 4 - Still Hungry
item.description: Maybe it started when we were kids, but most often find ourselves wanting just a little more. For most of us, that's also true of money. The problem is more is it has no end point. If you don't make your money serve God, you'll make money god.
item.content:encoded: Maybe it started when we were kids, but most often find ourselves wanting just a little more. For most of us, that's also true of money. The problem is more is it has no end point. If you don't make your money serve God, you'll make money god.

item.title: Eyes on the Road
item.itunes:title: Eyes on the Road
item.description: People who were not like Jesus liked Jesus, and he liked them back. Since the church is the body of Christ, people should be drawn to Jesus followers. Even if they don't agree with the message of the church, they should like the church. So, why isn't that true?
item.content:encoded: People who were not like Jesus liked Jesus, and he liked them back. Since the church is the body of Christ, people should be drawn to Jesus followers. Even if they don't agree with the message of the church, they should like the church. So, why isn't that true?

item.title: Better Plotline - Part 3 - He Doesn't Deserve Forgiveness
item.itunes:title: Better Plotline - Part 3 - He Doesn't Deserve Forgiveness
item.description: What do you do when people hurt you? Sometimes it seems impossible to forgive. Revenge is about what you want from someone. Forgiveness is about what you want for them-and ultimately for you. Few people show us how to practice forgiveness better than King David.
item.content:encoded: What do you do when people hurt you? Sometimes it seems impossible to forgive. Revenge is about what you want from someone. Forgiveness is about what you want for them-and ultimately for you. Few people show us how to practice forgiveness better than King David.

item.title: Better Plotline - Part 2 - My Messed Up Family
item.itunes:title: Better Plotline - Part 2 - My Messed Up Family
item.description: Family stirs up such mixed emotions. It's often the source of our deepest joy and our deepest wounds. ¬†And the people closest to you seem to drive you the most crazy. Why is that? And what can you do about it?
item.content:encoded: Family stirs up such mixed emotions. It's often the source of our deepest joy and our deepest wounds. And the people closest to you seem to drive you the most crazy. Why is that? And what can you do about it?

item.title: Better Plotline - Part 1 - Lust or Love?
item.itunes:title: Better Plotline - Part 1 - Lust or Love?
item.description: How do you know you really love someone? Believe it or not, much of what masquerades as love in our culture is actually lust. How do you know the difference?
item.content:encoded: How do you know you really love someone? Believe it or not, much of what masquerades as love in our culture is actually lust. How do you know the difference?

item.title: Stress [Less] - Part 5 - Happy Ending
item.itunes:title: Stress [Less] - Part 5 - Happy Ending
item.description: When your stress leads you to the end of your rope, what should you do? Simple. Change what's at the end of your rope. Swap out your big fear for a big God. Today, we'll show you how to do that.
item.content:encoded: When your stress leads you to the end of your rope, what should you do? Simple. Change what's at the end of your rope. Swap out your big fear for a big God. Today, we'll show you how to do that.

item.title: Stress [Less] - Part 4 - Change Up
item.itunes:title: Stress [Less] - Part 4 - Change Up
item.description: You can practice everything we've talked about so far to help you lessen your worry, anxiety and stress. But sometimes that's not enough. What if a large part of the problem with your stress is the source and frequency of the information pouring into your life. Has the rise of social media and 24/7 communication made it easier to be at peace, or more difficult? And what can you do about it?
item.content:encoded: You can practice everything we've talked about so far to help you lessen your worry, anxiety and stress. But sometimes that's not enough. What if a large part of the problem with your stress is the source and frequency of the information pouring into your life. Has the rise of social media and 24/7 communication made it easier to be at peace, or more difficult? And what can you do about it?

item.title: Stress [Less] - Part 3 - What About My Kids?
item.itunes:title: Stress [Less] - Part 3 - What About My Kids?
item.description: Dealing with stress as an adult is one thing. But what about your kids? More and more teens seem to struggle with stress, worry, anxiety and depression than ever before. In this message, Carey not only looks at scripture, he interviews Dr. Rob Meeder, a pediatrician who specializes in treating teens and children for depression and anxiety. Together, they'll share practical ways to help destress your kids and help them deal with anxiety.
item.content:encoded: Dealing with stress as an adult is one thing. But what about your kids? More and more teens seem to struggle with stress, worry, anxiety and depression than ever before. In this message, Carey not only looks at scripture, he interviews Dr. Rob Meeder, a pediatrician who specializes in treating teens and children for depression and anxiety. Together, they'll share practical ways to help destress your kids and help them deal with anxiety.

item.title: Stress [less] - Part 2 - Don't Just Sit There...
item.itunes:title: Stress [less] - Part 2 - Don't Just Sit There...
item.description:
Understanding the source of your stress is one thing. But what can you do about it? After all, so much of life feels out of control: work, how people respond to you, your family, the political situation. The question is...if God is in control, is there anything you can or even should do about these things. What's your role? And what's God's role?

¬†
item.content:encoded: Understanding the source of your stress is one thing. But what can you do about it? After all, so much of life feels out of control: work, how people respond to you, your family, the political situation. The question is...if God is in control, is there anything you can or even should do about these things. What's your role? And what's God's role?

item.title: Stress[less] - Part 1 - The End of Your Rope
item.itunes:title: Stress[less] - Part 1 - The End of Your Rope
item.description: So you're stressed, worried or even anxious. What's going on? Well, if you dig a little deeper, it's like your stress and anxiety are tied to a rope that has something at the end‚Ä¶.often, something that's hidden from you. What's at the end of your rope can tell you a lot about why you worry and how to reduce your anxiety.
item.content:encoded: So you're stressed, worried or even anxious. What's going on? Well, if you dig a little deeper, it's like your stress and anxiety are tied to a rope that has something at the end‚Ä¶.often, something that's hidden from you. What's at the end of your rope can tell you a lot about why you worry and how to reduce your anxiety.

item.title: Get Your Life Back - Part 6 - Nope
item.itunes:title: Get Your Life Back - Part 6 - Nope
item.description:
If you're going to live your life with great purpose, one of the most important skills you can develop is learning how to say no. That's a tough discipline to foster, especially if you want people to like you. We'll look at biblical story that clearly explains the problems with saying yes to everything, and we'll look at how you can learn to say no to the things that matter less...nicely.

¬†
item.content:encoded: If you're going to live your life with great purpose, one of the most important skills you can develop is learning how to say no. That's a tough discipline to foster, especially if you want people to like you. We'll look at biblical story that clearly explains the problems with saying yes to everything, and we'll look at how you can learn to say no to the things that matter less...nicely.

item.title: Get Your Life Back - Part 5 - On Purpose
item.itunes:title: Get Your Life Back - Part 5 - On Purpose
item.description: What's your life really all about? If you don't know how to answer that question, it will be hard to figure out how to spend your time. Jesus knew precisely what his life was about, and knew there would be 1000 distractions that would try to keep from accomplishing it. We'll look at why you don't get the most important things in your life done and a very practical way to change that. ¬†
item.content:encoded: What's your life really all about? If you don't know how to answer that question, it will be hard to figure out how to spend your time. Jesus knew precisely what his life was about, and knew there would be 1000 distractions that would try to keep from accomplishing it. We'll look at why you don't get the most important things in your life done and a very practical way to change that.

item.title: Get Your Life Back - Part 4 - Completely Unfair
item.itunes:title: Get Your Life Back - Part 4 - Completely Unfair
item.description: Why is it that hanging out with some people totally energizes you, while hanging out with other people actually drains you? Sure...it's a chemistry thing. But it's deeper than that. You would think Jesus spent equal time with all people, but he didn't. In fact, he was completely unfair. He followed a principle that literally changed the world. We'll study it and how it applies to your life.
item.content:encoded: Why is it that hanging out with some people totally energizes you, while hanging out with other people actually drains you? Sure...it's a chemistry thing. But it's deeper than that. You would think Jesus spent equal time with all people, but he didn't. In fact, he was completely unfair. He followed a principle that literally changed the world. We'll study it and how it applies to your life.

item.title: Get Your Life Back - Part 3 - Energy Crisis
item.itunes:title: Get Your Life Back - Part 3 - Energy Crisis
item.description: While everyone might get 24 hours a day, not all hours are created equal. Your energy ebbs and flows throughout the day. Sometimes you're on top of the world, other times you struggle to stay awake. What's with that? Surprisingly, even Jesus dealt with the limitations of human existence in his time on earth. This week, we'll show you how to make the most of your limits.
item.content:encoded: While everyone might get 24 hours a day, not all hours are created equal. Your energy ebbs and flows throughout the day. Sometimes you're on top of the world, other times you struggle to stay awake. What's with that? Surprisingly, even Jesus dealt with the limitations of human existence in his time on earth. This week, we'll show you how to make the most of your limits.

item.title: Get Your Life Back - Part 2 - I Just Don't Have The Time
item.itunes:title: Get Your Life Back - Part 2 - I Just Don't Have The Time
item.description: Ever wish you had more time? And yet you've probably noticed that when you get more responsibility at work or you decide to have another child, nobody gives you any additional time. No matter how complicated your life gets, all you get is 24 hours a day. ¬†In this message, we review three gifts God has given everyone and explore why simply managing time is never the solution to your time management issues.
item.content:encoded: Ever wish you had more time? And yet you've probably noticed that when you get more responsibility at work or you decide to have another child, nobody gives you any additional time. No matter how complicated your life gets, all you get is 24 hours a day. In this message, we review three gifts God has given everyone and explore why simply managing time is never the solution to your time management issues.

item.title: Get Your Life Back - Part 1 - Unbalanced
item.itunes:title: Get Your Life Back - Part 1 - Unbalanced
item.description: So many people think the key to beating overwhelm is to find balance. What if it isn't? When you look at history, meaningful lives are rarely characterized by balance. Jesus and other biblical figures that changed history could hardly be described as balanced people. Instead they're lives were characterized by something far greater. It could transform your life too.
item.content:encoded: So many people think the key to beating overwhelm is to find balance. What if it isn't? When you look at history, meaningful lives are rarely characterized by balance. Jesus and other biblical figures that changed history could hardly be described as balanced people. Instead they're lives were characterized by something far greater. It could transform your life too.

item.title: Teach Me How To Pray
item.itunes:title: Teach Me How To Pray
item.description: Of all the things you could do this year, what could make the biggest difference? What if the answer is prayer? Yet many people struggle with prayer. So what if Jesus taught you how to pray? To kick off 2017, we'll look at exactly what Jesus said when people asked him to teach them how to pray.
item.content:encoded: Of all the things you could do this year, what could make the biggest difference? What if the answer is prayer? Yet many people struggle with prayer. So what if Jesus taught you how to pray? To kick off 2017, we'll look at exactly what Jesus said when people asked him to teach them how to pray.

item.title: Light of The World - Part 3 - It's Personal
item.itunes:title: Light of The World - Part 3 - It's Personal
item.description: God knows what you need. He sent Jesus into the world for you, to meet your greatest need. The Christmas story is personal. Here's how to make it your story.
item.content:encoded: God knows what you need. He sent Jesus into the world for you, to meet your greatest need. The Christmas story is personal. Here's how to make it your story.

item.title: Light Of The World - Toddler King
item.itunes:title: Light Of The World - Toddler King
item.description: There's a light that can cut through your doubt, anger, sin, shame, and disappointment with God. Here's what you need to do to find it.
item.content:encoded: There's a light that can cut through your doubt, anger, sin, shame, and disappointment with God. Here's what you need to do to find it.

item.title: Light Of The World - Part 1 - Most Wonderful
item.itunes:title: Light Of The World - Part 1 - Most Wonderful
item.description: For many, the Christmas season is complicated. It's a reminder of broken relationships, unmet expectations, and missed loved ones. But no matter your circumstances, Christmas can also be a reminder of the light that overcomes the darkness.
item.content:encoded: For many, the Christmas season is complicated. It's a reminder of broken relationships, unmet expectations, and missed loved ones. But no matter your circumstances, Christmas can also be a reminder of the light that overcomes the darkness.

item.title: Non-Committal - Part 4 - Being Married
item.itunes:title: Non-Committal - Part 4 - Being Married
item.description: Getting married is one thing. Being married is another. The journey actually just starts when you become a Christian. There's a life together that can be deeply challenging but also tremendously rewarding. The ancients called it 'sanctification,' and this week we'll explore what it actually means to be a Christian and how that looks over a lifetime.
item.content:encoded: Getting married is one thing. Being married is another. The journey actually just starts when you become a Christian. There's a life together that can be deeply challenging but also tremendously rewarding. The ancients called it 'sanctification,' and this week we'll explore what it actually means to be a Christian and how that looks over a lifetime.

item.title: Non-Committal - Part 3 - Getting Married
item.itunes:title: Non-Committal - Part 3 - Getting Married
item.description: So what exactly happens when a couple gets married? Why is it that one minute, they can simply break up, but the next minute they have to get an annulment or even a divorce? Well, at a wedding, something permanent happens. It's exactly the same when you become a Christian. We'll look at what happens, why it happens and how to make it happen so something changes forever in your life. ¬†
item.content:encoded: So what exactly happens when a couple gets married? Why is it that one minute, they can simply break up, but the next minute they have to get an annulment or even a divorce? Well, at a wedding, something permanent happens. It's exactly the same when you become a Christian. We'll look at what happens, why it happens and how to make it happen so something changes forever in your life.

item.title: Non-Committal - Part 2 - Non-Committal
item.itunes:title: Non-Committal - Part 2 - Non-Committal
item.description: So it's going well enough to make it permanent, sort of. You like her enough to stick around, but you're afraid of commitment. So you move in together. Frankly, that's what a lot of people do with Jesus. They don't want to commit, but they don't want to leave. The question is: where does that leave you?
item.content:encoded: So it's going well enough to make it permanent, sort of. You like her enough to stick around, but you're afraid of commitment. So you move in together. Frankly, that's what a lot of people do with Jesus. They don't want to commit, but they don't want to leave. The question is: where does that leave you?

item.title: Non-Committal - Part 1 - True Love?
item.itunes:title: Non-Committal - Part 1 - True Love?
item.description: Every relationship starts out with two people who like each other. Your emotions take over. You feel things you haven't felt before. But then you ask yourself: is this just a phase? Will it go as quickly as it came? Can it be this fun for long? The same thing happens spiritually. What begins as a curiosity about Jesus always lands somewhere else. But what do you do with that?
item.content:encoded: Every relationship starts out with two people who like each other. Your emotions take over. You feel things you haven't felt before. But then you ask yourself: is this just a phase? Will it go as quickly as it came? Can it be this fun for long? The same thing happens spiritually. What begins as a curiosity about Jesus always lands somewhere else. But what do you do with that?

item.title: Brand: New - Part 5 - Redefining Terms
item.itunes:title: Brand: New - Part 5 - Redefining Terms
item.description: Don't like the church? Is that your fault or the church's? In this episode of Brand:New, Andy exposes how the church veered off course.
item.content:encoded: Don't like the church? Is that your fault or the church's? In this episode of Brand:New, Andy exposes how the church veered off course.

item.title: Brand: New - Part 4 - What Love Requires
item.itunes:title: Brand: New - Part 4 - What Love Requires
item.description: Want to know the one thing Jesus said you can't avoid with loopholes, shortcuts, or workarounds? Watch this episode of¬†Brand:New.
item.content:encoded: Want to know the one thing Jesus said you can't avoid with loopholes, shortcuts, or workarounds? Watch this episode of Brand:New.

item.title: Brand: New - Part 3 - Recycled
item.itunes:title: Brand: New - Part 3 - Recycled
item.description: Religion is powerful‚Äîso powerful it can shape the way we view ourselves and treat others.¬†For more, watch this episode of Brand:New entitled 'Recycled.'
item.content:encoded: Religion is powerful‚Äîso powerful it can shape the way we view ourselves and treat others. For more, watch this episode of Brand:New entitled 'Recycled.'

item.title: Brand: New - Part 2 - Apoplectic
item.itunes:title: Brand: New - Part 2 - Apoplectic
item.description: Jesus stepped into a world where religion was characterized by the Temple Model and initiated something entirely new.¬†For more, watch this episode of¬†Brand:New entitled "Apoplectic."
item.content:encoded: Jesus stepped into a world where religion was characterized by the Temple Model and initiated something entirely new. For more, watch this episode of Brand:New entitled "Apoplectic."

item.title: Brand: New - Part 1 - Letting Go
item.itunes:title: Brand: New - Part 1 - Letting Go
item.description: The arrival of Jesus signalled the end of the Temple Model and the beginning of something entirely new! For more, watch this first episode of Brand:New entitled Letting Go.
item.content:encoded: The arrival of Jesus signalled the end of the Temple Model and the beginning of something entirely new! For more, watch this first episode of Brand:New entitled Letting Go.

item.title: For The City
item.itunes:title: For The City
item.description: Every day our friends and neighbours feel like life is against them, and in some cases God is against them. Imagine if people in the cities of Barrie and Orillia knew that Connexus was a community of people who was FOR the city? Even more importantly, what if our church and our lives became a megaphone to let them know that Jesus is FOR them?
item.content:encoded: Every day our friends and neighbours feel like life is against them, and in some cases God is against them. Imagine if people in the cities of Barrie and Orillia knew that Connexus was a community of people who was FOR the city? Even more importantly, what if our church and our lives became a megaphone to let them know that Jesus is FOR them?

item.title: Imagine Heaven - Part 6 - So What?
item.itunes:title: Imagine Heaven - Part 6 - So What?
item.description: Even if you have a clearer understanding of eternity than ever, knowledge can still leave you with the question "So what?" Maybe the ultimate question isn't ¬†"So what if it's true?" Perhaps the ultimate question is "So what are you going to do?" The decision you make about Jesus today echoes forever.
item.content:encoded: Even if you have a clearer understanding of eternity than ever, knowledge can still leave you with the question "So what?" item.title: Imagine Heaven - Part 4 - The Highlight of Heaven
item.itunes:title: Imagine Heaven - Part 4 - The Highlight of Heaven
item.description: A common, beautiful thread weaving many stories of near death experiences together is that of the overwhelming love they felt in the presence of Jesus, the being of light. This was in spite of the fact that He knew everything about them, good and bad. That kind of all-seeing,¬†unconditional love is what we all crave deep within our hearts. But is this being actually Jesus...or who is he?

item.title: Imagine Heaven - Part 3 - Love You (To The Moon And Back)
item.itunes:title: Imagine Heaven - Part 3 - Love You (To The Moon And Back)
item.description: So...will you recognize the people you love in heaven? Will the relationships that mattered most to you in life matter in heaven? Many NDEs reveal a lot about relationship and so does scripture. We'll look at what our relationships will be like in heaven, and how that changes things on earth.

item.title: Imagine Heaven - Part 2 - Everything New
item.itunes:title: Imagine Heaven - Part 2 - Everything New
item.description: Perhaps the most common theme from NDEs is experiencing a beauty that fills the soul and is hard to put into words. People who get a glimpse of the world to come encounter a majesty that is beyond their ability to fully comprehend. ¬†It turns out that this heavenly world is the one that the Bible has been pointing to all along.

item.title: Imagine Heaven - Part 1 - Confessions of a Pastor
item.itunes:title: Imagine Heaven - Part 1 - Confessions of a Pastor
item.description: So is heaven real? Like real, real? And if it is, what's it like? We'll share 5 misconceptions about heaven in this message, and look at what scripture points us toward. We'll also look at some near death experience accounts, both ancient and current. Maybe if someone came back from the dead and told us what heaven is like, we'd believe. ¬†
item.content:encoded: So is heaven real? Like real, real? And if it is, what's it like? We'll share 5 misconceptions about heaven in this message, and look at what scripture points us toward. We'll also look at some near death experience accounts, both ancient and current. Maybe if someone came back from the dead and told us what heaven is like, we'd believe.

item.title: In The Meantime - Part 6 - Comfort Zone
item.itunes:title: In The Meantime - Part 6 - Comfort Zone
item.description: When we're in the midst of pain and suffering, it can feel like we'll never be happy again, nothing good can come from our circumstances, and there's no reason to continue living. But those are lies. God can redeem, use, and work through our pain. And when he does, we eventually have the opportunity to comfort others. There is a "Fellowship of Suffering." People who've suffered are uniquely equipped and qualified to comfort people who are suffering.
item.content:encoded: When we're in the midst of pain and suffering, it can feel like we'll never be happy again, nothing good can come from our circumstances, and there's no reason to continue living. But those are lies. God can redeem, use, and work through our pain. And when he does, we eventually have the opportunity to comfort others. There is a "Fellowship of Suffering." People who've suffered are uniquely equipped and qualified to comfort people who are suffering.

item.title: In The Meantime - Part 5 - Believe It Or Not
item.itunes:title: In The Meantime - Part 5 - Believe It Or Not
item.description: Jesus told his followers that unavoidable trials aren't aberrations; they are expectations. They can actually serve a beneficial purpose. Why? Because God can redeem, use, or work through the undeserved, unavoidable, circumstantial trials in our lives. But in order for that to happen, we have to believe and persevere.
item.content:encoded: Jesus told his followers that unavoidable trials aren't aberrations; they are expectations. They can actually serve a beneficial purpose. Why? Because God can redeem, use, or work through the undeserved, unavoidable, circumstantial trials in our lives. But in order for that to happen, we have to believe and persevere.

item.title: In The Meantime - Part 4 - Where's Your Focus
item.itunes:title: In The Meantime - Part 4 - Where's Your Focus
item.description: What do you do when life hasn't gone in the direction you hoped or wanted it to go and there's nothing you can do to change your circumstances? What do you do when you're living in "the meantime"? If you've ever been In the meantime or if you're currently in the meantime, you can't help but conclude you'll never be happy again, nothing good can come from your circumstances, and there's no point in continuing. Can it really be true that God will make things right?
item.content:encoded: What do you do when life hasn't gone in the direction you hoped or wanted it to go and there's nothing you can do to change your circumstances? What do you do when you're living in "the meantime"? If you've ever been In the meantime or if you're currently in the meantime, you can't help but conclude you'll never be happy again, nothing good can come from your circumstances, and there's no point in continuing. Can it really be true that God will make things right?

item.title: In The Meantime - Part 3 - Yes, You Can
item.itunes:title: In The Meantime - Part 3 - Yes, You Can
item.description: What do you do when there's nothing you can do? Relationally, financially, professionally, physically, or academically, It just is what it is. There's nothing you can do to change your situation. Challenging circumstances can make you jealous or resentful. They can make you angry with God. They can breed discontentment. But the problem with discontentment is that it can drive you in self-destructive directions that will eventually leave you with regret. So, what is the secret of finding contentment even when times are tough?
item.content:encoded: What do you do when there's nothing you can do? Relationally, financially, professionally, physically, or academically, It just is what it is. There's nothing you can do to change your situation. Challenging circumstances can make you jealous or resentful. They can make you angry with God. They can breed discontentment. But the problem with discontentment is that it can drive you in self-destructive directions that will eventually leave you with regret. So, what is the secret of finding contentment even when times are tough?

item.title: In The Meantime - Part 2 - A Purpose And A Promise
item.itunes:title: In The Meantime - Part 2 - A Purpose And A Promise
item.description: Every once in a while, we run into people stuck in unchangeable, unalterable, in-the-meantime circumstances who get to the place where they're able and willing to receive their circumstances, their afflictions, their illnesses, their losses, and their disabilities as coming from the hand of their heavenly Father. How do these people maintain extraordinary faith despite extraordinarily difficult circumstances? Where do they find the peace that characterizes their lives?
item.content:encoded: Every once in a while, we run into people stuck in unchangeable, unalterable, in-the-meantime circumstances who get to the place where they're able and willing to receive their circumstances, their afflictions, their illnesses, their losses, and their disabilities as coming from the hand of their heavenly Father. How do these people maintain extraordinary faith despite extraordinarily difficult circumstances? Where do they find the peace that characterizes their lives?

item.title: In The Meantime - Part 1 - The New Normal
item.itunes:title: In The Meantime - Part 1 - The New Normal
item.description: What do we do when our circumstances are so challenging there's no way forward and no way out? We have problems for which there seem to be no solutions. We have questions without answers. During times like these, we're tempted to run or give up. We're tempted to give in to jealousy, resentment, and anger . . . especially anger toward God. That's because when life gets hard, it feels like God is absent, apathetic, or angry. But what if he isn't? Is it possible to hang on to joy, hope, and patience in the meantime?
item.content:encoded: What do we do when our circumstances are so challenging there's no way forward and no way out? We have problems for which there seem to be no solutions. We have questions without answers. During times like these, we're tempted to run or give up. We're tempted to give in to jealousy, resentment, and anger . . . especially anger toward God. That's because when life gets hard, it feels like God is absent, apathetic, or angry. But what if he isn't? Is it possible to hang on to joy, hope, and patience in the meantime?

item.title: Selfie - Part 4 - Your Win/Loss Record
item.itunes:title: Selfie - Part 4 - Your Win/Loss Record
item.description: A beautiful car, a nice house, a great family, a great tattoo, the right friends; our culture of marketing is constantly trying to define success for us. Social media becomes a giant comparison trap. There is no doubt that hard work, success, and achievement can open some doors. But what happens when what you do starts to define who you are? What happens when success and failure begin to drive how you experience life and how you feel? What is success doing to your heart? What is failure doing to your soul?
item.content:encoded: A beautiful car, a nice house, a great family, a great tattoo, the right friends; our culture of marketing is constantly trying to define success for us. Social media becomes a giant comparison trap. There is no doubt that hard work, success, and achievement can open some doors. But what happens when what you do starts to define who you are? What happens when success and failure begin to drive how you experience life and how you feel? What is success doing to your heart? What is failure doing to your soul?

item.title: Selfie - Part 3 - Money, Money, Money
item.itunes:title: Selfie - Part 3 - Money, Money, Money
item.description: Of all the things that can confuse the human heart, money is among the most vexing. We all need it. Most of us want more. But even when we gain more, our appetite isn't satisfied. Why? Jesus identifies the heart of the problem, and this week, we'll show you an option that will help curb your longing for more.
item.content:encoded: Of all the things that can confuse the human heart, money is among the most vexing. We all need it. Most of us want more. But even when we gain more, our appetite isn't satisfied. Why? Jesus identifies the heart of the problem, and this week, we'll show you an option that will help curb your longing for more.

item.title: Selfie - Part 2 - Live Makes The World Go Round
item.itunes:title: Selfie - Part 2 - Live Makes The World Go Round
item.description: Nothing touches us more deeply than the relationships we have with those closest to us. No human bond is stronger than the love for a family member or close friend. They are also the ones who can hurt and disappoint us the most. Why is it that these loving relationships fall apart? How can we love someone so much, only to have that love fade? How come families move from a place of love to disappointment so quickly?

item.title: Selfie - Part 1 - Never Enough
item.itunes:title: Selfie - Part 1 - Never Enough
item.description: Ever notice that what you think will satisfy doesn't? Money, success, homes, relationships and even family often promise more than the seem to deliver. You always want more. Why? This week, we'll introduce you to how idols‚Äìeven sophisticated idols‚Äîwork, and why elevating the gift God gives you above the Giver always disappoints.

item.itunes:title: Bad Blood - Part 4 - Shaking The Dust Off
item.description:
No matter how badly you want peace, there are some relationships that may never be fully restored. But doing this one thing can help you find peace about any relationship.

¬†

item.title: Bad Blood - Part 3 - A Conversation or a Confrontation
item.itunes:title: Bad Blood - Part 3 - A Conversation or a Confrontation
item.description: Jesus says if you have bad blood with another person, you should go and have a conversation with him or her. But why should you go, when should you go, and how should you go?

item.title: Bad Blood - Part 2 - Holding On
item.itunes:title: Bad Blood - Part 2 - Holding On
item.description: What do you do when you have bad blood with someone who owes you something? Bad blood is costly and complicated. It costs you peace and complicates your other relationships. If you don't find peace in that "bad blood" relationship, your other relationships will suffer. The good news is that you can have peace about the relationship even without peace in the relationship.

item.title: Bad Blood - Part 1 - The Empathy Lens
item.itunes:title: Bad Blood - Part 1 - The Empathy Lens
item.description: Bad blood can infect any relationship. And the quality of our lives is only as good as the quality of our relationships. Lack of peace about a relationship robs you of peace in your own life. But you can have peace about a relationship even without peace in the relationship. Happiness comes from peace with God, peace with yourself, and peace with others.

item.title: I Can't Believe In A God Who... - Part 7 - Who Leaves Me Feeling Hopeless

item.description: If God is love, why do people often feel so hopeless? Perhaps it's because we tie our hope to circumstances and emotions. God invites us to tie our circumstances to something profoundly different. Even something unshakable.

item.title: I Can't Believe In A God Who... - Part 6 - Who Picked A Faulty Bible To Communicate With Us
item.itunes:title: I Can't Believe In A God Who... - Part 6 - Who Picked A Faulty Bible To Communicate With Us
item.description: Maybe you think the Bible is unreliable or that, even as a historical book, it's riddled with errors and mistakes. This week, Carey will be joined by world-renowned New Testament scholar Dr. Craig Evans, who has been interviewed on Dateline NBC, by the New York Times, Wall Street Journal and lectured at Yale, Princeton, Harvard and Oxford Universities. Together, they'll discuss why many of the world's brightest thinkers have come to trust the scriptures.

item.itunes:title: Supernatural - Part 1 - Ghost Stories
item.description: So is life only what we can see, touch and experience, or is there more? Is there a supernatural side? Are ghost reals? Are there supernatural beings? Do miracles still happen? We‚Äôll look at what the scripture has to say.

item.description: If you don‚Äôt give in or give up, what do you do? You give over whatever you‚Äôre struggling with to God. And we all struggle. Strangely, freedom from Christ (and his ways) isn‚Äôt freedom. Freedom in Christ is freedom. So if you want freedom, start surrendering.

item.title: Rubber Soul - Part 3 - Giving Up
item.itunes:title: Rubber Soul - Part 3 - Giving Up
item.description:
Giving in is one thing. But give in enough, and eventually you might decide that you no longer believe what you used to believe about a subject. So instead of giving in, you give up. Been there? Are God‚Äôs standards just too harsh? Too demanding? But people who have given up eventually must face one thing: the God they gave up on hasn‚Äôt given up on them.

item.title: Rubber Soul - Part 1 - Theory of Relativity
item.itunes:title: Rubber Soul - Part 1 - Theory of Relativity
item.description: So...is morality relative? Ask most people, and they‚Äôll tell you it is: what‚Äôs true for me isn‚Äôt automatically true for you. But at the heart of moral relativity is an interesting assumption‚Äîthat moral compromise compromises no one. What if there is a cost to moral relativity? A cost that you‚Äôre paying?
